relino: <entryFree id="n40981" type="main" key="re^li^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unpitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. passages): relevi dolia omnia, omnes serias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 51</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">servata mella Thesauris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to take out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 229</bibl></cit> (but for relevimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 38</bibl>, Fleck. reads rei erimus).</sense></entryFree>
relinquo: <entryFree id="n40982" type="main" key="re^linquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-linquo</orth>, <itype>līqui, lictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40982.0" n="I" level="1"> (With the idea of the <hi rend="ital">re</hi> predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi> (cf. desero, omitto). </sense><sense id="n40982.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to leave behind</hi> by removing one's self; <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move away from; to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi> (a person or thing). </sense><sense id="n40982.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum apud matrem domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse abiit foras, me reliquit pro atriensi in sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me filiis Relinquont quasi magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicerent non me plane de provinciā decessisse, quoniam alterum me reliquissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Fabium legatum cum legionibus II. castris praesidio relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me servum in servitute pro te hic reliqueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem, sc. in provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tergum hostem relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille omnibus precibus petere contendit, ut in Galliā relinqueretur,</quote> <trans><tr>might be left behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges pecorum . . . sub opacā valle reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 277</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea causa miles hic reliquit symbolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic exemplum reliquit ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hecuba) Hectoris in tumulo canum de vertice crinem . . . relinquit,</quote> <trans><tr>leaves behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cacumina silvae) limum tenent in fronde relictum,</quote> <trans><tr>left behind</tr>, <tr>remaining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:347" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 347</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi> one's self by moving away: <cit><quote lang="la">longius delatus aestu, sub sinistrā Britanniam relictam conspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque hos, jamque illos, populo mirante, relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:503" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 503</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be left behind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 626</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: hanc eram ipsam excusationem relicturus ad Caesarem, <hi rend="ital">was about to leave behind me just this excuse</hi> (for my departure), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeos in animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod coeptum est dici, relinquitur in cogitatione audientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate relictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetat relicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 97</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of rank or merit: (Homerus) omnes sine dubio et in omni genere eloquentiae procul a se reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40982.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To leave behind one</hi> by death; <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bequeath</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n40982.6" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea mortua est: reliquit filiam adulescentulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pauper cum duobus fratribus relictus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper jam a majoribus relictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri reliquit ei non magnum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem testamento reliquit hunc P. Quintium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei testamento sestertiūm milies relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si qui argentum omne legavit, videri potest signatam quoque pecuniam reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi reliquit haec quae habeo omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo, quid reliquit Phania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit> and 13: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos decem et tres reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum aeris alieni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus aut donatus aut testamento relictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui arva, greges, armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se testamento liberum relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave behind</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum ac virtutum nostrarum effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sic sunt, haud multum heredem juvant, Sibi vero hanc laudem relinquont: vixit, dum vixit, bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statum civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: memoriam<pb n="1558" /> <cb n="RELI" />  aut brevem aut nullam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum audaciae suae aeternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae scripta nobis summi ex Graeciā sapientissimique homines reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum in Originibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta posteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">in scriptis relictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes reliquit et annales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo tantum volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum de suis rebus imperfectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si non omnia vates Ficta reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater, o relictum Filiae nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To leave</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">behind;</hi> <hi rend="ital">to leave remaining; to allow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permit to remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40982.9" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil relinquo in aedibus, Nec vas, nec vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis autem non modo granum nullum, sed ne paleae quidem ex omni fructu atque ex annuo labore relinquerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de tanto patrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus partem illi adtribuit, partem sibi reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustioribus portis relictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">41: unam (filiam) minimamque relinque,</quote> <trans><tr>leave to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pauca aratro jugera regiae Moles relinquent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapis meliora relinquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis apta tibi tua dona relinquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec porcis hodie comedenda relinquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habitanda fana Apris reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquebatur una per Sequanos via,</quote> <trans><tr>remained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā ex parte leniter acclivis aditus relinquebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum paucis relictum videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud dicionis Atheniensium praeter ipsam urbem reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40982.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi corpori reliqueris Tuo potestatem coloris ulli capiendi mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam igitur relinquis populari rei publicae laudem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis non modo dignitatis retinendae, sed ne libertatis quidem recuperandae spes relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterorum sententiis semotis, relinquitur non mihi cum Torquato, sed virtuti cum voluptate certatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua spes in fugā relinqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā provocatione ad populum contra necem et verbera relicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis igitur relictus est objurgandi locus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est preci loci relictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in another sense: plane nec precibus nostris nec admonitionibus relinquit locum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he leaves no occasion for them</tr>, <tr>renders them superfluous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui iniquo relinqueremus vituperandi locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui nullum sibi ad cognoscendum spatium relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium deliberandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Eun, 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eun, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita turpis ne morti quidem honestae locum relinquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:253" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 253</bibl> (v. Bernhardy ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita relicta est tantum modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod munitioni castrorum tempus relinqui volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi consilium et virtutis vestrae regimen relinquite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem alicui relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veniae vel saevitiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 41</bibl></cit>: leto, poenaeque, id. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 217</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem direptioni et incendiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>, <tr>surrender</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu relinquas hominem innocentem ad alicujus tui dissimilis quaestum,</quote> <trans><tr>do not leave</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in alicujus spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(metus) Omnia suffundens mortis nigrore, neque ullam Esse voluptatem liquidam puramque relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:703" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 703</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ex parvo nobis tantundem haurire relinquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:708" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 708</bibl>: nihil relinquitur nisi fuga, <hi rend="ital">there is nothing left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, etc., Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquitur illud, quod vociferari non destitit, non debuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 34, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nihil relicti quicquam aliud jam esse intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 81</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> relinquitur, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">621): relinquitur, ut, si vincimur in Hispaniā, quiescamus,</quote> <trans><tr>it remains</tr>, <tr>that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: relinquebatur, ut neque longius ab agmine legionum discedi <cb n="RELI" /> Caesar pateretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— In a logical conclusion: relinquitur ergo, ut omnia tria genera sint causarum, <hi rend="ital">hence it follows that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40982.11" n="3" level="3"> With double predicate, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">behind</hi> in a certain state; <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer to be</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum Plautus locum Reliquit integrum,</quote> <trans><tr>has left untouched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum integram rem et causam reliquerim,</quote> <trans><tr>have left unaltered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaptius me rogat, ut rem sic relinquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">12: Morini, quos Caesar in Britanniam proficiscens pacatos reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amici, quos incorruptos Jugurtha reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquit (eam) Incertam et tristi turbatam volnere mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) in litore deligatas ad ancoram relinquebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat aeger in praesidio relictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediis lacerā nave relinquor aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod insepultos reliquissent eos, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid incohatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptam oppugnationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>, <tr>quit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incoepta fila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecta sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus incoeptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba imperfecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro effectis relinquunt, vixdum incohata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid injudicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid neglectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas copias sine imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ture aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum in ambiguo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem nullam nominabo: tantum in medio relinquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">correptio in dubio relicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40982.12" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of the verb predominant.) <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go away from; to forsake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n40982.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n40982.14" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illaec obsecrost quae me hic reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: relinquamus nebulonem hunc, Scip. Afr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te hic lubens relinquo neque abeo abs te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum propinquosque reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis locis superioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:36" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci relinquendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilio relicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus relictum Respicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 873</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma relinquenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles clamore relinqui (sc.: a bubus),</quote> <trans><tr>were left behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 216</bibl></cit> Wagn.: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres Ova relinquebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 802</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n40982.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: me somnu' reliquit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 52 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vita reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 63</bibl></cit>: reliquit aliquem vita, for <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 327</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vita tuos reliquerit artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 339</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also, reversely: animam relinquam potius, quam illas deseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 547</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen vitale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consitus sum senectute, vires Reliquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus reliquit euntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni honestate relictus,</quote> <trans><tr>abandoned</tr>, <tr>destitute of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab alterā (quartanā) relictum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 290</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40982.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to leave in the lurch; to forsake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi>, etc. (v. desero, destituo, prodo). </sense><sense id="n40982.17" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ... Reliquit deseruitque me,</quote> <trans><tr>has forsaken me</tr>, <tr>has given me the slip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquit me homo atque abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succurrere relictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 290</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the forsaking of a lover by his mistress,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos, qui ex fugā evaserant, reliquerunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>let them escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19</bibl></cit>. — Of things, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum si relinquo ac non peto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores signa relinquendi et deserendi castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">relictā non bene parmulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40982.18" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relinquish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem et causam et utilitatem communem non relinquere solum, sed etiam prodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 50</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">derelinquo jam communem causam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 103</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">jus suum dissolute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectum, cum ad summum perduxerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, <cb n="RELI" /> 1, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) Quod cupide petiit, mature plena reliquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: eum rogato, ut relinquat alias res et huc veniat, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay aside every thing else</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus relictis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">relictis rebus (omnibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1071" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1071</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: res omnes relictas habeo prae quod tu velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia relinques, si me amabis, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et agrorum et armorum cultum,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>, <tr>neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu ea relinquis et deseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:36:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium exquirendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum alternis annis,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer to lie fallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca relicta,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>, <tr>wild lands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 42" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 42</bibl></cit> Goes.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">relictae possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites bellum illud, quod erat in manibus, reliquisse,</quote> <trans><tr>abandoned</tr>, <tr>relinquished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. possessionem, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise the siege</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes relinquo, libidines praetereo,</quote> <trans><tr>leave unmentioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulto relinquere (locum), opp. praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc certe neque praetermittendum neque relinquendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">audistis haec, judices, quae nunc ego omnia praetereo et relinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 106</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 45, 165</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur injurias tuas conjunctas cum publicis reliquisti?</quote> <trans><tr>left unnoticed</tr>, <tr>uncensured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:33:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 33, § 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim et causam efficiendi reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos legatum omni supplicio interfectum relinquetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est, qui vim hominibus armatis factam relinqui putet oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si plane contueare, mirari multa relinquas,</quote> <trans><tr>leave off</tr>, <tr>cease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 654</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliquatio: <entryFree id="n40983" type="main" key="re^li^qua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reliquor</etym>, <sense id="n40983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arrearage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrears</hi> of a sum (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 44</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis, temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliquator: <entryFree id="n40984" type="main" key="re^li^qua_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one in arrears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a defaulter</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">superioris anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:9:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 4, 9, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem millium solidorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliquatrix: <entryFree id="n40985" type="hapax" key="re^li^qua_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reliquator</etym>, <sense id="n40985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that is in arrears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a defaultress</hi>, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">anima reliquatrix delictorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliquiae: <entryFree id="n40986" type="main" key="re_^li^qui^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rē^lĭquĭae</orth> (in the poets, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">rellĭqu-</orth>; cf. religio <sense id="n40986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), ārum (<hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> reliquiae, App. Apol. ap. Carm. p. 277, 13), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>relinquo, I. B. 1.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the leavings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remainder</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n40986.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40986.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">is navem atque omnia, perdidit in mari, Haec bonorum ejus sunt reliquiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de bonis quod restat reliquiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum mensum sunt relictae reliquiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.; cf. exercitūs, Auct. B. Alex. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae cladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:10" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 8</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:46:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum belli reliquiae peraguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:8:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danaūm,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the remnant of the Trojans who had escaped from the hands of the Greeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">598</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 87 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus generis reliquias restare video (sc. hominum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: gladiatoriae familiae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <trans><tr>excrements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 8, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40986.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40986.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The leavings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remnants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragments</hi> of food (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cenarum reliquiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125, 22</bibl></cit>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo si scias reliquiae quae sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras de reliquiis nos volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias ubi videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 25</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 6</bibl>.— Hence in a double sense: vellem Idibus Martiis me ad cenam (i. e. <hi rend="ital">to the assassination of Cæsar</hi>) invitasses: reliquiarum (i. e. <hi rend="ital">Antony</hi>) nihil fuisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40986.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ashes</hi> of a deceased person; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of a body that has been burned: C. Marii sitas reliquias apud Anienem dissipari jussit Sulla victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 56</bibl></cit>; <pb n="1559" /> <cb n="RELI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; 3, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 343</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 227</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquiae (polypi) adservatae miraculo pependere pondo DCC.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 93</bibl></cit>.—Hence in a double sense: <cit><quote lang="la">si funus id habendum sit, quo non amici conveniunt ad exsequias cohonestandas, sed bonorum emptores, ut carnifices ad reliquias vitae lacerandas et distrahendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40986.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> (unconsumed) <hi rend="ital">remains of</hi> the flesh of a sacrifice (different from exta), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40986.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">remnants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remainder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">animaï reddidit omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis illius aestus Reliquias vitae membris ex omnibus aufert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 825</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus vitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:955" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 955</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec reliquias maxime reliquiae rerum earum moventur in animis et agitantur, de quibus vigilantes aut cogitavimus aut agimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 67, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinae fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam palmam utinam di immortales, Scipio, tibi reservent, ut avi reliquias persequare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the finishing of the Punic war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cum est apud oratores frequentissimum, tum etiam in usu cottidiano quasdam reliquias habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliquo: <entryFree id="n40987" type="main" key="re^li^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. reliquor <sense id="n40987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
reliquor: <entryFree id="n40988" type="main" key="re^li^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n40988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form reliquavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 9</bibl>) [reliquus], <hi rend="ital">to be in arrears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave a balance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to owe a balance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain indebted</hi> (jurid. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n40988.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos debitores rerum publicarum accipere debemus, qui ex administratione reipublicae reliquantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si filius in muneribus publicis reliquatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:20:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2, 20, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:8:23" default="NO">33, 8, 23</bibl> pr.— </sense><sense id="n40988.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquatus est amplam summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitum ex conductione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:46" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reliquus: <entryFree id="n40989" type="main" key="re^li^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquus</orth> (sometimes written <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭcuus, rell-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-qus</orth>, v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 305</bibl>; Freund ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:page=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. p. 31</bibl>-34. Rēlĭcŭus as a quadrisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 560</bibl> Munro ad loc.; 4, 976), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>relinquo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n40989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is left</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is left behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>, = relictus (freq. and a good prose word; not found in Cat., Tib., Verg., or Hor.). </sense><sense id="n40989.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi unum ex plurimis miseriis reliquom fuerat malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut spes nulla reliqua in te siet tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potes mulo isto, quem tibi reliquum dicis esse, Romam pervehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erant oppida mihi etiam complura reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deprecatio est igitur ei reliqua, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">120: quibus lubido atque luxuria ex magnis rapinis nihil reliqui fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua alia optio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40989.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Without a <case>dat.</case>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 696</bibl> P.: ne a stirpe genus nostrum interiret et uti aliqua propago generis nostri reliqua esset (just before, restare), C. Gracch. ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9, p. 365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 9, p. 365</bibl> Orell.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neu causa ulla restet reliqua, Quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā (familiā) reliquus est M. Titurnius Rufus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos hos esse non ex bello ... sed ex tuo scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 124</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">moriar, si praeter te quemquam reliquum habeo, in quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; and with this cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 15</bibl> (p. 216 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui lucus in Graeciā totā tam sanctus fuit, in quo ullum simulacrum, ullum ornamentum reliquum sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua reliqua spes est, quae sociorum animos consolari possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>. — Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-quom</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that is left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a remainder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ab amatore suo postulat id, quod datum est, Sed reliquom dat operam, ne sit reliquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad vos, spectatores, reliquum relinquitur, More majorum date plausum, id. Cist. grex 5: ut pernoscatis, ecquid spei sit relicuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 5</bibl> (6), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">addendo deducendoque videre, quae reliqui summa fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid reliqui'st, quin habeat quae quidem in homine dicuntur bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim est huic reliqui, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reliqui nihil sit omnino, quod pertinet ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid reliqui habemus praeter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, quod ab hoste crudelius pati possent, reliqui quicquam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (syn. reliquiae):<cb n="RELI" />  illud breve vitae reliquum nec avide adpetendum senibus sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrigentum, quod belli reliquum erat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where alone the war was afterwards carried on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40</bibl></cit>; cf., in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua belli perfecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi reliquum vitae degere tuto posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 52, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 21" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 4</bibl>, the correct read. is: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquom vitae spatium, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).— So in late Lat. persaep.: reliqua verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40989.3" n="2" level="3"> Partic. constructions. </sense><sense id="n40989.4" n="a" level="4"> Reliquum est, ut, or with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquitur, restat, superest): reliquum est, ut officiis certemus inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ubi nunc est res publica, ibi simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit> (where B. and K. supply ut, ex conj.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, tuam profectionem amore prosequar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hortari modo reliquum est et ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3,22</bibl></cit> (p. 232 Gerl.).— </sense><sense id="n40989.5" n="b" level="4"> Reliquum (aliquem, aliquid) or aliquid reliqui facere, a periphrase for relinquere, and in the twofold signification of that word. </sense><sense id="n40989.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave remaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arent, quibus aratrum saltem aliquod satelles istius Apronius relicum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos belli calamitas reliquos fecerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">126: haec addita cura vix mihi vitam reliquam fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quos fortuna fecisset reliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos reliquos fortuna ex nocturnā caede ac fugā fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duarum mihi civitatum reliquos feci agros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have left to be considered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 104</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a remnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remainder</hi> (cf. 1, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra): <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquum vitae viriumque fames fecerat, id, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fortuna in malis reliqui fecit, id, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 32, 89</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. negatively: te nullum munus officii cuiquam reliquum fecisse,</quote> <trans><tr>have left behind you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus nihil non modo de fructu, sed ne de bonis quidem suis reliqui fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi milites nihil reliqui victis fecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 7</bibl></cit> Kritz; cf.: captā urbe nihil fit reliqui victis, id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 52, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus libido atque luxuria ex magnis rapinis nihil reliqui fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hoc quidem sibi reliqui facit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40989.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To leave undone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to omit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi> (rare and perh. only in the historians; <cit><quote lang="la">also only negatively): nihil ad celeritatem sibi reliqui fecerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>omitted nothing</tr>, <tr>made every exertion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus ab utrisque nihil reliquum fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nihil reliqui fecisse, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil reliqui faciunt, quominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40989.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40989.9" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">that is left</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">future</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsequent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe reliquae tranquillitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquae vitae dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua et sperata gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>: in reliquum tempus vectigalibus prospexi, Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55, § 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum in tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so, reliquum tempus (opp. praesenti bello),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ecastor ullo die risi adaeque, neque hoc, quod reliquom est (sc. vitae), plus risuram opinor,</quote> <trans><tr>in all my life</tr>, <tr>to the end of my days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in reliquum, adverb., <hi rend="ital">for the future</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in future</hi>, <hi rend="ital">henceforward</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:32" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.—</sense><sense id="n40989.10" n="2" level="3"> In mercantile lang., of debts, <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in arrear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquom, quod ex eo quod debitum reliquom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=175" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 175</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quod reliquom restat, volo persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dedi datum non vellem, quod reliquom est non dabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes putare argentariam ... quid venierit, quid exactum siet, quid reliquum siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei de ratiunculā Jampridem apud me reliquom pauxillulum Nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pecuniam reliquam Buthrotii ad diem solverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, § 4 (Cod. Faerni: pecuniae reliquum).—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭqua</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlĭquum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>), <hi rend="ital">the remainder</hi> of a debt, <hi rend="ital">balance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrears</hi>: reliqua <cb n="RELO" /> mea Camillus scribit se accepisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime me angit ratio reliquorum meorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanta reliqua sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 15, 3: dum reliqua colonorum minuit ad tempus, vires in posterum exhausit, quarum defectione rursus reliqua creverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37, 2</bibl>: Sticho reliqua habente, <hi rend="ital">holding a balance</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">being in arrears</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:81" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 81</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:46" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">computare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:34" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adaerandis reliquorum debitis (= reliquiis debitorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 15</bibl>.— In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte fidejussores minus idonei sunt et in reliquum non exsolutae quantitatis accesserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:47" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 47</bibl>.—Hence, by a lusus verbb., of a narration in arrears, <hi rend="ital">the rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remainder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipite reliquom, alieno uti nil moror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also the passage cited above,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40989.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of that which remains after a part just mentioned, <hi rend="ital">the remaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the other;</hi> and, in the <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the remainder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the rest</hi> of a thing (diff. from ceteri, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n40989.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus cum Romuli tum etiam reliquorum regum sapientiā definitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviros ... reliquos magistratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Servilius consul reliquique magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol dux et princeps et moderator luminum reliquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9, 9</bibl>; 6, 20, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum regale genus civitatis haud scio an reliquis simplicibus longe anteponendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res capitales et reliquas omnes judicabant iidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam sententiam, cum reliquis causis, haec quoque ratio eos deduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida, vicos, reliqua privata aedificia incendunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo cohortes in fronte constituit, reliquarum signa in subsidio collocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps ille (Plato) aream sibi sumpsit, in quā, etc....
