Reliqui disseruerunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the others</tr>, <tr>the rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (causā) et ipse sentiat et reliqui omnes me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum perinde aspernantur (Scythae) ac reliqui mortales appetunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps Jovem atque Junonem, reliquos, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thus, without a copula, Brutorum, C. Cassii, Cn. Domitii, C. Trebonii, reliquorum,</quote> <trans><tr>and so forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanus, cum patria illo modo loquens. reliquaque praeclare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 106</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si placet, in hunc diem hactenus. Reliqua (satis enim multa restant) differamus in crastinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, ambula, ibique reliqua alia fabulabimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua vaticinationis brevi esse confecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aderat janitor carceris et carnifex praetoris, reliqua,</quote> <trans><tr>and the like</tr>, <tr>and so forth</tr>, <tr>and so on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 124</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but post-class.: et reliqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40989.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore relicuo pugnam caedesque petessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 648</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum magno numero ex omni populi summa separato, reliquum populum distribuit in quinque classes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit Labieno ... cum legione ad fines Nerviorum veniat, reliquam partem exercitūs non putat exspectandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque de frumento reliquoque commeatu satis esse provisum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus quoque equis exceptis reliquam praedam concessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jampridem cupio Alexandream reliquamque Aegyptum visere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 38, 64</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene oblitus sum, reliquom dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum temporis cum magnā trepidatione vigilavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quidem hactenus: quod reliquum est, cottidie tabellarios habebis,</quote> <trans><tr>as for the rest</tr>, <tr>as for what remains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 72, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 48</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de reliquo quid tibi ego dicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, c, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
relisus: <entryFree id="n40990" type="main" key="re^li_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from relido.</entryFree>
rellig: <entryFree id="n40991" type="main" key="relli^g"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rellĭg-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rellĭqu-</orth>, v. relig- and reliqu-.</entryFree>
reloco: <entryFree id="n40992" type="main" key="re^lo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (late Lat.) <sense id="n40992.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring a thing back to its former place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="1560" /> <cb n="REMA" /> <hi rend="ital">replace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:75" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40992.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To let out again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 13, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:51" default="NO">19, 2, 51</bibl> praef.</sense></entryFree>
reloquus: <entryFree id="n40993" type="gloss" key="re^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>re-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n40993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">answering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc dicuntur eloquium ac reloqui in fanis Sabinis, e cellā dei quei loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 57</bibl></cit> Müll. (cf. Lachm. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 679</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
reluceo: <entryFree id="n40994" type="main" key="re^lu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine out; to blaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give light</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): stella relucet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:Fragm. N. D. 2:42:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. Fragm. N. D. 2, 42, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma reluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 385</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">relucens flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli ingens barba reluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 300</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis fulgore reluxit Sacra domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sigea igni freta lata relucent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis lucerna tranquillis noctibus relucet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">focus reluxit vivo torre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:115" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e Vesuvio flammae relucebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro favillā relucenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
relucesco: <entryFree id="n40995" type="main" key="re^lu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lūcesco</orth>, <itype>luxi, lucescĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [re-luceo], <hi rend="ital">to grow bright again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become clear</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">luna plena luminis effigie relucescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 870</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis imago reluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reluxit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum reluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reluctanter: <entryFree id="n40996" type="main" key="re^luctanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕluctanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>relucto</etym>, <sense id="n40996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reluctantly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Lib. Arbitr. 3:69" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Lib. Arbitr. 3, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
relucto: <entryFree id="n40997" type="main" key="re^lucto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlucto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. reluctor <sense id="n40997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
reluctor: <entryFree id="n40998" type="main" key="re^luctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕluctor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n40998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. part. pres.</hi> reluctanti, Ov Am. 3, 4, 14), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to struggle against</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: repugno, renitor, adversor). </sense><sense id="n40998.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">visit cubiculum, in quo reluctantis et impulsae (uxoris) vestigia cernebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic spiritus oris Multa reluctanti obstruitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reluctantes dracones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis reluctans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites illic poscentia cursum Ora reluctantur pressis sedare lupatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf 2, 354</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40998.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">Mycale, quam deduxisse canendo Saepe reluctatae constabat cornua lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter obstantia saxa fractis aquis ac reluctantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reluctantur faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1729" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domitare ventos reluctantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40998.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist; to be adverse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reluctant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reluctatus invitusque revertens in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 102, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diu sum equidem reluctatus, Quint. prooem. § 1: diuque precibus ipsum reluctatum aegre vicerunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:35:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 35, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his tot tantisque rationibus, quamquam multum reluctata verecundia Principis nostri, tandem tamen, cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis reluctantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl></cit>.?*! </sense><sense id="n40998.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form: <cit><quote lang="la">faucibus ipsis hiantis Cerberi reluctabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus et venter reluctabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 189, 38; Fulg. contr Verg.— </sense><sense id="n40998.5" n="2" level="3"> Reluctatus, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reludo: <entryFree id="n40999" type="main" key="re^lu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jeer at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banter</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ipse reludat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarios mariti jocos relusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:10:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reluminatio: <entryFree id="n41000" type="gloss" key="re^lu_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕlūmĭnātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)ntaugasi/a</foreign> [relumino], Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
relumino: <entryFree id="n41001" type="main" key="re^lu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light up again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reillumine</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caecos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to restore to sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 30, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reluo: <entryFree id="n41002" type="hapax" key="re^lu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to redeem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take out of pawn</hi>, sc. a pledge: aurum, vestem, Caecil. ap. Fest. s. h. v. p. 281 Müll. (resolvere, repignerare, Fest.).</sense></entryFree>
rema: <entryFree id="n41003" type="spur" key="Re^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a false read. for Remoram, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 15</bibl> Vahl.</entryFree>
remacresco: <entryFree id="n41004" type="main" key="re^ma_^cresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mā^cresco</orth>, <itype>crŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow very lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remaledico: <entryFree id="n41005" type="main" key="re^ma^le^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mălĕdīco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to return reproachful language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revile back</hi>: non oportere maledici senatoribus, remaledici civile fasque esse, Vespas. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remancipo: <entryFree id="n41006" type="main" key="re^manci^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mancĭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to transfer back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remancipate</hi>: quem pater eā lege mancipio dedit, ut sibi remanciparetur,<cb n="REME" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:140" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:1:172" default="NO">1, 172</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. remancipatam, p. 277 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
remando: <entryFree id="n41007" type="main" key="re^mando1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mando</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (late Lat.). <sense id="n41007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To send back word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to notify in return</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41007.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To repeat a command</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manda, remanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 28, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41008" type="main" key="re^mando2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mando</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chew over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to chew the cud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruminate</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pontici mures simili modo remandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 73, 93, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium scripta et lecta saepius revolvendi et quasi eundem cibum remandendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remaneo: <entryFree id="n41009" type="main" key="re^ma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mănĕo</orth>, <itype>mansi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain behind</hi> (freq. and class.: cf. commoror). </sense><sense id="n41009.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sermone confecto, Catulus remansit, nos ad naviculas nostras descendimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl> (opp. discessus): <cit><quote lang="la">qui per causam valetudinis remansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris Pompei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubito remanete presso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fugis? O remane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 477</bibl></cit> (opp. deserere) et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres nostrae Romae remanserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem cum imperio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum ex hastili in corpore remanserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tam pauci remanserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41009.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at manet in vitā, cui mens animusque remansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 402</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expone igitur primum animos remanere post mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos eodem remanere vestigio adsuefaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia antiqui officii remanent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum usque ad nostram memoriam disciplina navalis et gloria remansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duris remanentem rebus amicum,</quote> <trans><tr>persevering</tr>, <tr>constant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie remanente coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remanentes spicas,</quote> <trans><tr>the remaining ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulla apud vos memoria remanet avi mei Masinissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nomen (i. e. hostis) a peregrino recepit et proprie in eo, qui arma contra ferret, remansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis aeterna sollicitudo remanebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quam contumeliam remanere in exercitu victore sinat,</quote> <trans><tr>would suffer to cleave to the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ex contagione noxae remaneret penes nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est oratori necessarium, ab iis petere necesse est, apud quos remansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid antiqui remanet tibi vigoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua materia seditionis remaneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum se de cohorte Alexandri remansisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41009.3" n="2" level="3"> With an <hi rend="ital">adjectival predicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> in a certain state or condition (cf. relinquo, I. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (sublicarum) pars inferior integra remanebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (potentia senatūs) gravis et magna remanebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cognoscenda remansit Herculis effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 264</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remano: <entryFree id="n41010" type="main" key="re^ma_no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-māno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow back</hi> (Lucretian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:635" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 635</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41011" type="main" key="re^ma_no2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, v. remeo <sense id="n41011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
remansio: <entryFree id="n41012" type="main" key="re^mansi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmansĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>remaneo</etym>, <sense id="n41012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remaining behind; a remaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuing</hi> in one's place (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">profectio animum tuum non debet offendere: num igitur remansio? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua remansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remansor: <entryFree id="n41013" type="gloss" key="remansor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">remansor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41013.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A soldier who stays at home by permission of his commander</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 347, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41013.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A soldier who overstays his furlough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 5, § 6</bibl> (but emansor is the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:4:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 4, § 13</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
remeabilis: <entryFree id="n41014" type="main" key="re^me^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remeo</etym>, <sense id="n41014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that goes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comes back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">returning</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">saxum (i. e. of Sisyphus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:537" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus e tumulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1117</bibl></cit>: anima in corpora, Tert Res. Carn. 1.</sense></entryFree>
remeaculum: <entryFree id="n41015" type="hapax" key="re^me^a_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a way back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a return</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remeatus: <entryFree id="n41016" type="main" key="re^me^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a return</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remediabilis: <entryFree id="n41017" type="main" key="re^me^di^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕdĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remedio</etym>. <sense id="n41017.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be healed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curable;</hi> only trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">(philosophia) fuit aliquando simplicior inter minora peccantes et levi quoque curā remediabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41017.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedial</hi>: bonum <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 14</bibl>. <cb n="REME" /></sense></entryFree>
remedialis: <entryFree id="n41018" type="main" key="re^me^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remedio</etym>, <sense id="n41018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remediatio: <entryFree id="n41019" type="main" key="re^me^di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕdĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 11" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remediator: <entryFree id="n41020" type="main" key="re^me^di^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕdĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remedio: <entryFree id="n41021" type="main" key="re^me^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [remedium], <hi rend="ital">to heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi> (post-class.; cf.: sano, curo, medico). </sense><sense id="n41021.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 11" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:18" default="NO">18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Scapul. 4 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n41021.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remedium: <entryFree id="n41022" type="main" key="re^me^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>re-medeor</etym>, <sense id="n41022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which heals again; a cure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n41022.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">medicine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio remedi certa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantheras, quae in barbariā venenatā carne caperentur, remedium quoddam habere, quo cum essent usae, non morerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrariis remediis sanant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium est magni et recentis doloris sanguis missus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra omnium morsus remedio est gallinaceum cerebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum ejus contra alia ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 39, § 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Pecc. Merit. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Pecc. Merit. 2, 3</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinere cibo omni, aut potu, etc.... in praesentissimis remediis habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in remedio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium ad fauces pollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41022.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amulet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic preventive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui remedia quartanae vel doloris alterius collo gestaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41022.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a means of aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">relief; a remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad magnitudinem frigorum remedium comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">remedia sibi comparare ad tolerandum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium quaerere ad moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus consulta senatūs et decreta principum vel magistratuum remedium nullum est, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus reliqua uti remediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium in ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius tanti vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmae memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus metūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc unum his tot in commodis remedium esse arbitrarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: quibus rebus nostri haec reperiebant remedia, ut, etc., Caes B. C. 3, 50; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veneficiis remedia invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod remedium huic malo inveniam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; id. Phorm, 1, 4, 23; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 3, 11: acrioribus saluti suae remediis subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id remedium timori fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum utrumque ipsi pro remedio aegris rebus discordiā intestinā petissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ira et questus, et postquam non subinveniebat (Olennius) remedium ex bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remeligo: <entryFree id="n41023" type="main" key="re^me^li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=277" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 277</bibl> Müll. from remoror, and hence qs. for remŏrigo</etym>, perh. i. q. 1. remora, but concr., <sense id="n41023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that delays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hinders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> (<hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">delayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderer</hi>: remeligines et remorae a remorando dictae sunt a Plauto in Casinā (4, 3, 6): nam quid illaec nunc tamdiu intus remorantur remeligines. Ab Afranio in Prodito: remeligo a Laribus missa sum, Fest. l. l. (the palimpsest of Plautus, acc. to Ritschl's collation, has, instead of the last two words of the verse in question, remoranturreme ... ); cf.: Remelicines remoratrices, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
rememini: <entryFree id="n41024" type="hapax" key="re^me^mi^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mĕmĭni</orth>, <itype>isse</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to recall to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remember</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rememoratio: <entryFree id="n41025" type="main" key="re^me^mo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕmŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rememoror</etym>, <sense id="n41025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">remembrance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">69, 1</bibl> (transl. of the Greek of the Sept. <foreign lang="greek">a)na/mnhsis</foreign>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rememoror: <entryFree id="n41026" type="main" key="re^me^mo^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĕmŏror</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>re-memor</etym>, <sense id="n41026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remember again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call to mind</hi> (late Lat.).— With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remoramini pristinos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 10, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 109</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rememorati sunt quia Deus adjutor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:77:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 77, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remensus: <entryFree id="n41027" type="main" key="re^mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. remetior, I. A. and B.</entryFree>
remeo: <entryFree id="n41028" type="main" key="re^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (not freq. till after the <pb n="1561" /> <cb n="REME" /> Aug. period; only once in Cic.; in Cæs. not at all; syn.: redeo, regredior). </sense><sense id="n41028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remeabo intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remeato audacter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ludum, Afr. ap. Fest. s. h. v. p. 277 Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 151 Rib.): in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrias in sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursum in terga (with cedere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se (legati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Campaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Aegypto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem remeante nuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus remeabat disjecto agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. Suet. Vit. Plin. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(coturnices) cum ex Italiā trans mare remeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges nocte remeabant ad stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 39, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n41028.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and late Lat. with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrias remeabo inglorius urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euboicos penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destinatas remeārunt sedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7</bibl></cit> pr.—</sense><sense id="n41028.3" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects: cum umore consumpto neque terra ali posset neque remearet aër, <hi rend="ital">would flow back again</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) mari remeabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remeante flumine,</quote> <trans><tr>receding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis adfluunt bisque remeant (aquae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 212</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41028.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to come back</hi> as a victor, <hi rend="ital">return home</hi> in triumph (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. Cort. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 256</bibl>; Burm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:589" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 589</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">victor ad Argos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">victor domito ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythicis Crassus victor ab oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc neque te longi remeantem pompa triumphi Excipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:164" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 164</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: vetitos remeare triumphos, <hi rend="ital">to return home to the triumph denied</hi> (<hi rend="ital">me</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 256</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41028.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transiit aetas, Quam cito, non segnis stat remeatque dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si natura juberet A certis annis aevom remeare peractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 94</bibl></cit>.—In discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ordinem remeabo coeptorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 24 al.</bibl></cit>?*! Lengthened collat. form remānant = remeant (like dănunt = dant, prodīnunt = prodeunt, redīnunt = redeunt): rivos camposque remanant, Enn. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=282" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 282</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 72 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
remergo: <entryFree id="n41029" type="hapax" key="re^mergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immerse again;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">soporis altitudine remerguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remetior: <entryFree id="n41030" type="main" key="re^me_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n41030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mete again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mete back</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n41030.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter retro remensumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo rite memor servata remetior astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: frumentum pecuniā remetiri, <hi rend="ital">to measure back with money</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pay for with an equal measure of money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā mensurā mensi fueritis, remetietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 4, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41030.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41030.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To measure back</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">travel over again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:324" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stadia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagoque remenso, Improvisi aderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remenso mari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41030.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to void</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discharge back again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille fide summā testae sua vina remensus, Reddidit oenophori pondera plena sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:89:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 89, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum omne vomitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 3, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41030.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> in one's mind; <hi rend="ital">to think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon; to tell again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum diem mecum scrutor, facta ac dicta mea remetior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 123, 35.— </sense><sense id="n41030.6" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass over again</hi>: transmissum discrimen convalescendo remetiri, <hi rend="ital">to remeasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in recovering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the danger surmounted</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be continually advancing in recovery</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remex: <entryFree id="n41031" type="main" key="re_mex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmex</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype> (<sense id="n41031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> remigium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:7" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 7</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>remus-ago</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a rower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oarsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5</bibl>. 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 18</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of Charon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 557" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 557</bibl>.—Of the fish that swallowed Jonah: <cit><quote lang="la">remige inimico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41031.1" n="b" level="4"> Remex, collect. for remiges, <hi rend="ital">a bench of rowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the oarsmen</hi> of a vessel (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vacuos sensit sine remige portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Velocem Mnestheus agit acri remige Pristim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl> (4, 11), 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> M 6, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:57" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non remigem, non socios navalis ad classem frequentis habiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl>: remex<cb n="REMI" />  militis officia turbabat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milite ac remige,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remi: <entryFree id="n41032" type="main" key="Re_mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēmi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhēmi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n41032.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A considerable people of Gaul</hi>, in the region round about the modern Rheims, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl> sq.; 9; 12; 3, 11; 5, 3 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:67 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 67 sq.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iccius Remus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 424</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41032.1" n="II" level="1"> In later authors, <hi rend="ital">the chief town of the</hi> Remi, now <hi rend="ital">Rheims</hi> (in earlier writers, Durocortorum; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 44</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remigatio: <entryFree id="n41033" type="hapax" key="re_mi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>remigo</etym>, <sense id="n41033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rowing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remigium: <entryFree id="n41034" type="main" key="re_mi^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmĭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>remex</etym>. <sense id="n41034.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines remigio sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli remigio noctemque diemque fatigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus decem dierum remigio ab oppido distans (just before: abest a Ptolemaide quinque dierum navigatione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 3, 2, § 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41034.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto). </sense><sense id="n41034.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The parts of a vessel that belong to the rowing of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 202</bibl>; Hor C. 1, 14, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 44</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">remigio veloque festinare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with all possible speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit> (cf.: remis velisque; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 1. remus, I. A.): meo remigio rem gero,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I steer my own course</tr>, <tr>do just as I please</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 152</bibl></cit> (v. l. meo remigio remigo; cf. Brix ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n41034.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of wings: <cit><quote lang="la">remigi oblitae (aves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volat ille per aëra magnum Remigio alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 301</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 19</bibl> (mentioned in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aquila) remigium dextrā laevāque porrigens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179 al.</bibl></cit> (cf. in the Gr. Aesch. Agam. 52: <foreign lang="greek">pteru/gwn e)retmoi=sin e)resso/menoi</foreign>).— </sense><sense id="n41034.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Those that perform the rowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the oarsmen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigium classicique milites, tranquillo in altum evecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 39</bibl>; 33, 48; 37, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1, 14, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 471</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigium vitiosum Ulixei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remigo: <entryFree id="n41035" type="main" key="re_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to row</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum mavis? statimne vela facere, an paululum remigare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non intermisso remigandi labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 46, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigare alnum (i. e. navem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 178</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remigro: <entryFree id="n41036" type="main" key="re^mi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">journey back; to go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41036.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere ut remigret domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in domum suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domum veterem e novā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 966</bibl></cit>. trans Rhenum in suos vicos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4</bibl>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">in agros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitum est ei remigrare Kalendis Quintilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41036.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deos (anima sapientis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 23, 19</bibl></cit>. remigrat animus nunc demum mihi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remillum: <entryFree id="n41037" type="gloss" key="remillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">remillum</orth> <itype>dicitur quasi repandum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=277" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 277</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
reminiscentiae: <entryFree id="n41038" type="main" key="re^mi^niscenti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĭniscentĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reminiscor</etym>, <sense id="n41038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recollections</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remembrances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reminiscences</hi>, a transl. of the Platonic <foreign lang="greek">a)namnh/seis,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reminiscor: <entryFree id="n41039" type="main" key="re^mi^niscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mĭniscor</orth>, <itype>sci</itype>, <sense id="n41039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root men; whence mens, memini; v. comminiscor]. </sense><sense id="n41039.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To recall to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remember</hi> (syn. recordor): <cit><quote lang="la">reminisci, quom ea quae tenuit mens ac memoria, cogitando repetuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 44</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">se non tum illa discere, sed reminiscendo recognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te de aliis quibusdam quaestoribus reminiscentem recordari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: reminisceretur veteris incommodi populi Romani, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satyri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reminiscere quae traduntur mysteriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ea potius reminiscere, quae, etc., Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbitatem pristini temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces Argos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo dulces amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 714</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 7, 15</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reminiscere, totius imum Nil esse in summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="REMI" /> 90; 6, 649; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 256</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 293</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reminiscerentur quam majestatem accepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41039.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si ipse fingere vellet, neque plura bona reminisci, neque majora posset consequi, quam vel fortuna vel natura tribuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 1</bibl></cit> dub. (al. comminisci): <cit><quote lang="la">reminiscimini quod respondeatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 338, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finge quidvis, reminiscere, excogita, quid possit magicum videri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 308, 33.?*! <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmĭnisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.; censured by <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 48</bibl> and 49.</sense></entryFree>
remipes: <entryFree id="n41040" type="main" key="re_mi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remus</etym>, <sense id="n41040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oar-footed</hi>, i. e. which has oars for feet (Auson.): <cit><quote lang="la">anates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lembi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 10, 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remisceo: <entryFree id="n41041" type="main" key="re^misce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-miscĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n41041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, mixtum or <itype>mistum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to mix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingle again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mix up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermingle</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages). </sense><sense id="n41041.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum remixtum cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41041.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic veris falsa remiscet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus naturae suae remiscebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remixto carmine tibiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remissa: <entryFree id="n41042" type="main" key="re^missa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n41042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [remitto], <hi rend="ital">a pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remission</hi> (eccl. Lat., for remissio): <cit><quote lang="la">peccatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
remissarius: <entryFree id="n41043" type="hapax" key="re^missa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be easily shoved back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectes,</quote> <trans><tr>a sliding bolt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
remisse: <entryFree id="n41044" type="main" key="re^misse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. remitto, <sense id="n41044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
remissibilis: <entryFree id="n41045" type="main" key="re^missi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissĭbĭlis</orth>, e. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remitto</etym> (postclass). <sense id="n41045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remissible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41045.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:164" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remissio: <entryFree id="n41046" type="main" key="re^missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (acc. to remitto, I. A. and B.), <sense id="n41046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">releasing</hi> </sense><sense id="n41046.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare). </sense><sense id="n41046.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sending back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">returning;</hi> of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidum captivorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of things, <hi rend="ital">a throwing back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41046.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A letting down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superciliorum aut remissione aut contractione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41046.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41046.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A slackening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remitting;
