remission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abatement</hi> (syn. relaxatio): <cit><quote lang="la">animus intentione suā depellit pressum omnem ponderum, remissione autem sic urgetur, ut se nequeat extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones vocis et remissiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 314</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">sfugmo\s</foreign> est intentio motūs et remissio in corde et in arteria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissio lenitatis quādam gravitate et contentione firmatur,</quote> <trans><tr>laxity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales igitur amicitiae sunt remissione usus eluendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senescentis morbi remissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 99" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41046.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Slackness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laxness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in acerbissimā injuriā remissio animi ac dissolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41046.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Relaxation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recreation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnem animi remissionem ludumque descendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem non quies, non remissio, non aequalium studia, non ludi delectarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">danda est omnibus aliqua remissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:8:section=11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 8, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3, 1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 49, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora curarum remissionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41046.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lenity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Adversarius) tum ad severitatem, tum ad remissionem animi est contorquen dus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit> (cf. remissus, B. 1.): so, <cit><quote lang="la">remissione poenae,</quote> <trans><tr>by a relaxing</tr>, <tr>diminishing of punishment</tr>, <tr>by a milder punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41046.9" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to remitto, I. B. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">A remitting</hi> of a penalty, etc., <hi rend="ital">a remission</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissio tributi in triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiationis,</quote> <trans><tr>remission</tr>, <tr>abrogation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:8:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 8, § 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post magnas remissiones,</quote> <trans><tr>reduction of rent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 37, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41046.10" n="C" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">remission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgiveness</hi> of sin, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">delicti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: peccatorum, Ambros. de Isaac et Anim. 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 26, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 2, 38</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n41046.11" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A repetition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova ludorum remissio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 60, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remissivus: <entryFree id="n41047" type="main" key="re^missi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n41047.0" n="I" level="1"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">relaxing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laxative</hi>: relaxare<pb n="1562" /> <cb n="REMI" />  tumentia rebus congruis et remissivis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41047.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram.: adverbia, <hi rend="ital">formed to express the idea in a weakened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moderated sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remissive</hi> (like pedetentim, paulatim, sensim, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1021</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
remissor: <entryFree id="n41048" type="main" key="re^missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>remitto</etym>, <sense id="n41048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who remits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forgives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. Min. 1, 17, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati, Hilar. Psa. 121, 8: peccatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Psa. 39, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remissus: <entryFree id="n41049" type="main" key="re^missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from remitto.</entryFree>
remitto: <entryFree id="n41050" type="main" key="re^mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n41050.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to return</hi> (class. and very freq.; cf. reddo). </sense><sense id="n41050.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41050.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Redde mihi illam (filiam) ... Non remissura es mihi illam? ... non remittes? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Non remittam! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 29 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a legione omnes remissi sunt domum Thebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos in regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabium cum legione in sua hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem legionum in sua castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad parentes aliquem nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is argentum huc remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum tibi remisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: pila intercepta, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurl back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tractum de corpore telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras Caesari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta ad eum mandata per eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides etiam, quantā vi tigna trabesque Respuat umor aquae? .. Tam cupide sursum revomit magis atque remittit,</quote> <trans><tr>drives back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 199</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aquas longe (cautes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 583" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calces (equi),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>kick out behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41050.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To send forth</hi> from itself, <hi rend="ital">give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut melius muriā, quam testa marina remittit,</quote> <trans><tr>gives forth</tr>, <tr>yields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum seri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem (humus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeruginem (vasa aenea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umenti sensit tellure remitti (nebulas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem ex se ipsa remittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod baca remisit olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem e pulmone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41050.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41050.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To let go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relax</hi> any thing strained, bound, rigid, etc. (syn. relaxo; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. intendo, adduco): in agro ambulanti ramulum adductum, ut remissus esset, in oculum suum recidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas vel adducere vel remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 191</bibl></cit> (opp. retinere); <cit><quote lang="la">6, 228: lora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vela pennarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira contractis, hilaritas remissis (superciliis) ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor remissis (digitis) magis quam tensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 229</bibl></cit>: junctasque manus remisit; <cit><quote lang="la">vinclis remissis, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 314</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">digitum contrahens ac remittens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 94</bibl></cit>: bracchia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to let sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 202</bibl>: remissas manus, <hi rend="ital">sinking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">failing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore mella Cogit hiems eademque calor liquefacta remittit,</quote> <trans><tr>dissolves again</tr>, <tr>melts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se purpureo vere remittit humus,</quote> <trans><tr>opens again</tr>, <tr>thaws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere remissus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:126" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 126</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41050.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti tractata notam labemque remittunt Atramenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 235</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41050.7" n="c" level="4"> Jurid. t. t.: remittere nuntium or repudium, <hi rend="ital">to send a bill of divorce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dissolve a marriage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">betrothal;</hi> v. nuntius and repudium.— </sense><sense id="n41050.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41050.9" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to send back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(specula) simulacra remittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 337</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem late nemora alta remittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:929" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 929</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totidemque remisit Verba locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorda sonum ... remittit acutum (with reddere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos me imperatoris nomine appellavistis: cujus si vos paenitet, vestrum vobis beneficium remitto, mihi meum restituite nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam ipsis (imperium) remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: integram causam <cb n="REMI" /> ad senatum remittit, <hi rend="ital">refers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus appellatum erit, si forte ad eosdem remittemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:21" default="NO">12, 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to return</tr>, <tr>repay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nisi respuis ex animo longeque remittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem animo,</quote> <trans><tr>to dismiss</tr>, <tr>reject</tr>, <tr>cast off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ab omnibus conceditur, id reddo ac remitto,</quote> <trans><tr>resign it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utramque provinciam remitto, exercitum depono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliam togatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 9, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41050.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41050.11" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to I A. 2. a.) <hi rend="ital">To slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remit</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sonorum tum intendens tum remittens persequetur gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sonorum vis) tum remittit animos, tum contrahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: quaero enim non quibus intendam rebus animum, sed quibus relaxem ac remittam, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recreate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 383, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut requiescerem curamque animi remitterem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 61, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum per dies festos licentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31</bibl></cit>; and in a like sense with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and mid.: mirum est, ut opusculis animus intendatur remittaturque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos a contentione pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos a certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos a religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil apud milites remittitur a summo certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris temporis contentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam in perdiscendo ac memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curam et diligentiam remittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum illud suum studium remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:320" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 93, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea studia remissa temporibus revocavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urguent tamen et nihil remittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 77</bibl></cit>: equites petere ut sibi laxaret aliquid laboris; <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ille, ne nihil remissum dicatis, remitto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidie aliquid iracundiae remittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horam de meis legitimis horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de severitate cogendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 17, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de saevitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 25 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo, quod ipse potest in dicendo, aliquantum remittet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex pristinā virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex curā verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:22" default="NO">7, 1, 22</bibl>.—With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum viris fortissimis remittere de summā non potuisse, te mulieri deterrimae recte remississe, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:35:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 35, § 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de voluntate nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil e solito luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex arrogantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 27 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum aequo animo remittendum de celeritate existumabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41050.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi> to do any thing (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): si cogites, remittas jam me onerare injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque remittit quid ubique hostis ageret explorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid bellicosus Cantaber cogitet, remittas Quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41050.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or mid., <hi rend="ital">to relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi dolor et inflammatio se remiserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se furor ille remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (febres) certum habent circuitum et ex toto remittuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. under II.—</sense><sense id="n41050.14" n="(d)" level="5"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to recreate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem, cum scripsi, eundem etiam cum remittor, lego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fas est et carmine remitti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra: animus remittatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To give free course to</hi> (opp. continere): <cit><quote lang="la">animi appetitus, qui tum remitterentur, tum continerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41050.15" n="b" level="4"> With respect to a person, <hi rend="ital">to free</hi> one <hi rend="ital">from</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi> a thing to any one (= concedere, condonare); with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the offence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tranioni remitte quaeso hanc noxiam causā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">quare tum cito senex ille remisit injuriam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex animo tibi volens omne delictum remittam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 29</bibl></cit>; so freq. in late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to remit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forgive</hi> a sin or offence: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blasphemia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 8, 22</bibl></cit>. — Freq. with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the penalty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: ipso remittente Verginio ultimam <cb n="REMI" /> poenam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 59, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tibi ista concedam et remittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 106</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui remittere atque concedere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: meam animadversionem et suppli cium ... remitto tibi et condono, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod natura remittit, Invida jura negant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per populum Romanum stipendium remittatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias, quas erant in publicum Varroni cives Romani polliciti, remittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53</bibl>: aedes (venditas) alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi> a purchase, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patria tantum nobis in nostrum privatum usum, quantum ipsi superesse posset, remitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem imperare debuisti ex foedere: remisisti in triennium: militem nullum umquam poposcisti per tot annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi remittunt omnes istam voluptatem et eā se carere patiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>resign that pleasure to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut memoriam simultatium patriae remitteret,</quote> <trans><tr>sacrifice to his country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">privata odia publicis utilitatibus remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sibi poenam magistri equitum remitteret (dictator),</quote> <trans><tr>that he would remit for their sake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator consulibus in senatu magnifice conlaudatis et suarum quoque rerum illis remisso honore, dictaturā se abdicavit,</quote> <trans><tr>having been resigned in their favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus ipsi remittent,</quote> <trans><tr>will abandon their claim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 7</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remittentibus tribunis plebis comitia per interregem sunt habita,</quote> <trans><tr>withdrawing their opposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tributo remiserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc ipsi remitti vellent, remitterent ipsi de maritumis custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41050.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mora damnosa est nec res dubitare remittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 376</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Fides) occulte saevire vetat, prodesse remittit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 37</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41050.17" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to decrease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi> (very rare, but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si forte ventus remisisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum remiserant dolores pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si remittent quippiam Philumenae dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumor remittens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapor calidus primo non remittit propter levitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>does not sink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. A. 2. a.), <hi rend="ital">slack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi> (opp. contentus, contendere): <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:852" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 852</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n41050.18" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut onera contentis corporibus facilius feruntur, remissis opprimunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox, ut nervi, quo remissior, hoc gravior et plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridens Venus et remisso Filius arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ammoniacum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>liquid</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41050.19" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, both in a good and bad sense. </sense><sense id="n41050.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-humored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gay</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis, mitis, dulcis): remissior ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissiora frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantūs remissiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 254</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum intentis tum remissis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me non improbissime Dolabella tractasset, dubitassem fortasse, utrum remissior essem, an summo jure contenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo sermone non remissi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissus et subridens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi magistratus valde lenes et remissi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ulciscendo remissior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. ad Quir. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus (with lenis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remississimo ad otium et ad omnem comitatem animo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>most prone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissus et mitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristibus severe, cum remissis jucunde vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decorus est sermo senis quietus et remissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissius genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia remissior esse debet et liberior et dulcior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressiones dulces et remissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 164</bibl></cit>: joci, <hi rend="ital">gay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merry</hi> (opp. curae graves), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 319</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remissiores hilarioresque sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:547" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 547</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41050.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Slack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remiss</hi> (syn. languidus): <cit><quote lang="la">esse remisso ac languido animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris languentibus atque animo remissis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: dolus Numidarum<pb n="1563" /> <cb n="REMO" />  nihil languidi neque remissi patiebatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">no negligence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:88:2" default="NO" valid="yes">88, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt agilem gnavumque remissi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissior in petendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita remissior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41050.22" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheaper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissior aliquanto ejus fuit aestimatio quam annona,</quote> <trans><tr>below the market price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:92:section=214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 92, § 214</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-missē</orth> (acc. to B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mildly</hi> (with leniter, urbane; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. severe, graviter, vehementer, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:71" default="NO">12, 10, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 91</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> is not found.</sense></entryFree>
remivagus: <entryFree id="n41051" type="hapax" key="re_mi^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmĭ-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>remus</etym>, <sense id="n41051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oar-wafted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impelled by oars</hi>: celox, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 533, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remixtus: <entryFree id="n41052" type="main" key="re^mixtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmixtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">remistus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from remisceo.</entryFree>
remmius: <entryFree id="n41053" type="main" key="Remmi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Remmĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n41053.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41053.1" n="II" level="1"> Lex Remmia de calumniatoribus, <hi rend="ital">of Remmius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Remmian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:13" default="NO">22, 5, 13</bibl>: quā, qui calumniabatur, damnabatur, si crimen approbare non poterat, Schol. ad Cic. l. l. (p. 431 Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
remolior: <entryFree id="n41054" type="main" key="re^mo_li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mōlĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n41054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">move back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe remoliri luctatur pondera terrae (Typhoëus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 354</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:527" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 527</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n41054.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stir</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take up again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>.?*! <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbe remolito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 504" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 504</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remollesco: <entryFree id="n41055" type="main" key="re^mollesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mollesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become soft again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow soft</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41055.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Hymettia sole Cera remollescit,</quote> <trans><tr>softens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole remollescit quae frigore constitit unda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>melts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 661</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41055.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: quod ea re (vino) ad laborem ferendum remollescere homines atque effeminari arbitrantur, <hi rend="ital">to be enervated</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si precibus numina justis Victa remollescunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are softened</tr>, <tr>touched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 378</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remollio: <entryFree id="n41056" type="main" key="re^mollio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mollio</orth>, no <sense id="n41056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make soft again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soften</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n41056.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grana umore remollita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare ... Salmacis enervet tactosque remolliat artus,</quote> <trans><tr>softens</tr>, <tr>weakens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 286</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41056.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo se inhibitum ac remolitum, quo minus, ut destinarat, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>softened</tr>, <tr>mollified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remoneo: <entryFree id="n41057" type="hapax" key="re^mo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mŏnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warn again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec benevole remonebam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remora: <entryFree id="n41058" type="main" key="re^mo^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passive resistance</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae Remoram faciunt rei privatae et publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. Lucil. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=276:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 276, 8</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">remora si sit,</quote> <trans><tr>if I delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorā ausus miserabiles casus levare multorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 8</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 15</bibl>, the correct read. is mora).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41059" type="main" key="Re^mo^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕmŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name given to Rome by Remus</hi>: certabant urbem Romam Remoramne vocarent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 85 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
remoramen: <entryFree id="n41060" type="hapax" key="re^mo^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmŏrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>remoror</etym>, <sense id="n41060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderance;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 567</bibl>; cf.: Remoramina impedimenta, Gloss. in Auct. Class. Vatic. tom. 8, p. 507, a, Mai.</sense></entryFree>
remoratio: <entryFree id="n41061" type="main" key="re^mo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delaying</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Don. Persev. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Don. Persev. 17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remorator: <entryFree id="n41062" type="hapax" key="re^mo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remoratrix: <entryFree id="n41063" type="gloss" key="re^mo^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmŏrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>remorator</etym>, <sense id="n41063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that delays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinders</hi>, Gloss. Cyril.</sense></entryFree>
remorbesco: <entryFree id="n41064" type="hapax" key="re^morbesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-morbesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [morbus], <hi rend="ital">to become sick again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer a relapse</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=277" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 277</bibl> Müll. (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 178</bibl> Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
remordeo: <entryFree id="n41065" type="main" key="re^mordeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mordeo</orth>, no <sense id="n41065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>rsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bite again;</hi> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and only in the trop. sense; <hi rend="ital">to vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me remorsurum petis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteritis male admissis peccata remordent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus se forte remordet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando haec te cura remordet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 261</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si juris materni cura remordet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 402</bibl></cit>: vitia castigata remordent, Juy. 2. 25.—In prose: sin tandem <cb n="REMO" /> libertatis desiderium remordet animos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remores: <entryFree id="n41066" type="gloss" key="re^mo^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmŏres</orth> <itype>aves in auspicio dicuntur, quae acturum aliquid remorari compellunt</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=276" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 276</bibl> Müll.: <sense id="n41066.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Remum dictum a tarditate, quippe talis naturae homines ab antiquis remores dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. Rom. 21" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. Rom. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
remoria: <entryFree id="n41067" type="gloss" key="remoria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">remoria</orth>, v. ‡ remurinus.</entryFree>
remoror: <entryFree id="n41068" type="main" key="re^mo^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mŏror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41068.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi> (so rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">nam quid illaec nunc tam diu intus remorantur remeligines?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res nulla foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 564</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed postquam remorata suos cognovit amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge, ne remorare. Non diu remoratus es: Jam venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:200 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 200 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiae contra fluvium flantes remorantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 717</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41068.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi> (syn. retardare; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec edepol remorata med est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">di illum perdant, qui me hodie remoratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae res, quae ceteros remorari solent, non retardarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox atque praeda castrorum hostes quominus victoriā uterentur remorata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis te longae remorentur fata senectae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>should preserve you to a good old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 19, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num unum diem postea L. Saturninum tribunum plebis et C. Servilium praetorem mors ac poena remorata est?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was it put off</tr>, <tr>deferred?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non remoratur ituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 220</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab negotiis numquam voluptas remorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>.—With inanimate and abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio te me iis epistulis potius et meas spes solitum esse remorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 233</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiunt, freno non remorante, dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:772" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 772</bibl></cit>.?*! <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">remorandust gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomi jactu remorata (Atalanta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 671</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remorsus: <entryFree id="n41069" type="main" key="re^morsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmorsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mordeo</etym>, <sense id="n41069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a biting back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in return</hi> (late Lat.), Primas. in Gal. ad c. s.</sense></entryFree>
remote: <entryFree id="n41070" type="main" key="re^mo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. removeo, <sense id="n41070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
remotio: <entryFree id="n41071" type="main" key="re^mo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>removeo</etym>, <sense id="n41071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdrawing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41071.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41071.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41071.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotio criminis est cum ejus intentio facti, quod ab adversario infertur, in alium aut in aliud demovetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:29:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 29, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remotus: <entryFree id="n41072" type="main" key="re^mo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from removeo.</entryFree>
removeo: <entryFree id="n41073" type="main" key="re^mo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype> (sync. <sense id="n41073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> remorant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:175" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 175</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> remosse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 69</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> remorunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:240" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 240</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to move back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw back; to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: amolior, repono, segrego). </sense><sense id="n41073.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolle hanc patinam, remove pernam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:163 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 163 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos ex conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:676" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena, Hor.S.2, 7, 74: tegimen,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora removerat ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>had driven away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto atque ablegato viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotis arbitris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custode remoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae jam infantem removerit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has weaned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves longas ab onerariis navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupas furcis ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra sex milia ab oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae natura occultavit ab oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia a latere modice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas a fronte ad aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:895" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 895</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a vulgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvos natos a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a conspectu, Auct. B. Afr. 62: plura de medio (with auferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanis oculos profanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactu viriles virgineo manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:467" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto sumus orbe remoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cb n="REMO" /> mensae remotae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 676</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paulum ab legionibus nostros removissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab exercitu, Auct. B. Afr. 54: praesidia ex iis locis, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in montes ex urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oculis manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propinquis suis ultra ducentesimum lapidem removeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41073.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">removete moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: sumptum removit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum conscientiā remotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotā subtilitate disputandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia removistis, avaritiam, imperitiam, superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 87:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 87, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto joco,</quote> <trans><tr>jesting aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto personarum complexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:30" default="NO">12, 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam anilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:493" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstantia fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:373" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 373</bibl></cit>: remove istaec, <hi rend="ital">no more of that</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">do not speak of it</hi>), Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab studio, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 14: aliquem ab republicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab hoc sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a legibus (sc. ferendis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a vitā (natura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a negotiis publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab omni ejusmodi negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab amicitiā alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>;
