cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, b, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">se a suspitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illam suspitionem ab sese removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim procul hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(levissima) secerni arbitror oportere atque ex oratione removeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:76:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 76, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum (statum) ex generalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes tribu remoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem thalamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 157</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se artibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ministerio sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tutelā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41073.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de quincunce remota est Uncia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 327</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">removed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">afar off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41073.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestribus ac remotis locis,</quote> <trans><tr>distant</tr>, <tr>retired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remoto loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs pars, i. e. penetralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 638</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in remoto,</quote> <trans><tr>far away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotius antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes, remotas a Germanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab arbitris remoto loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas a conspectu remota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">85: in quibus (studiis) remoti ab oculis populi omne otiosum tempus contrivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 764</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis oculis remotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis longā regione remotus Absim,</quote> <trans><tr>by however great a distance I am removed from you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">licet caeli regione remotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41073.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">removed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> from, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quae jam diu gesta et a memoriā remota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (narrationum) remotum a civilibus causis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura deūm longe remota Sensibus ab nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia remota ab justitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(defensio) remota ab utilitate rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a verā ratione longe remotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 853</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fabula) non a veritate modo, sed etiam a formā veritatis remota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae jura a vulgari intellegentiā remotiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo a forensi strepitu remotissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Vestorium) hominem remotum a dialecticis, in arithmeticis satis versatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines maxime ab injuriis nostrorum magistratuum remoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Tib. Gracchi aequitate ac pudore longissime remotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic a culpā est remotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab inani laude et sermonibus vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vulgo longe lateque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio ab omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni minimi errati suspicione remotissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vilica) a vino, ab escis, a superstitionibus remotissima sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n41073.6" n="2" level="3"> In the philos. lang. of the Stoics, remota, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/na,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">things not to be preferred;<pb n="1564" /> <cb n="REMU" />  things to be rejected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">postponed</hi> (opp. promota), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at a distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afar off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remotely</hi> (very rare).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae eundem orbem tenentes aliae propius a terris, aliae remotius ab eisdem principiis eadem spatia conficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 12:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remugio: <entryFree id="n41074" type="main" key="re^mu_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mūgĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bellow back; to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad mea verba remugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sibylla antro remugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus remugit Mons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 928</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ionius remugiens sinus Noto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitu nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus alio bellatore (i. e. tauro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:602" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus latratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 675" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 675</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox assensu nemornm ingeminata remugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur clamor caelumque remugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve tympanum remugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remulceo: <entryFree id="n41075" type="main" key="re^mulce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mulcĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stroke back</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare). </sense><sense id="n41075.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to droop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to stroke gently</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 350, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41075.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to soothe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minas stimulataque corda remulce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:93" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos dulcissimis modulis,</quote> <trans><tr>to delight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remulco: <entryFree id="n41076" type="main" key="re^mulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmulco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. remulcum.</entryFree>
remulcum: <entryFree id="n41077" type="greek" key="re^mulcum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmulcum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rymulcum</orth>, acc. to the Gr., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl>), i (for the most part only in <case>abl.</case>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">r(umoulke/w</foreign></etym>, nautical t. t., <sense id="n41077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tow-rope</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">any other contrivance for towing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remulcum funis, quo deligata navis magnā trahitur vice remi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remulco est, cum scaphae remis navis magna trahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=279" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 279</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem remulco abstraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">submersam navim remulco adduxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: naves onerarias remulco Alexandriam deducit, Auct. B. Alex. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem remulco trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 16</bibl>. — Here prob. belongs the fragment of Sisenna: in altum remulco trahit, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 57, 29</bibl> (where Nonius erroneously assumes a verb, remulco, āre; cf. supra, the article of Festus, where also remulco forms the heading); Valgius ap. Isid. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 49</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non contis nec rymulco, ut aiunt, sed velificatione plenā in rempublicam ferebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remulsus: <entryFree id="n41078" type="main" key="re^mulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from remulceo.</entryFree>
remulus: <entryFree id="n41079" type="hapax" key="re_mu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. remus</etym>, <sense id="n41079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small oar</hi>, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 533, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41080" type="main" key="Re^mu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41080.1" n="I" level="1"> Remulus Silvius, <hi rend="ital">a king of Alba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 616</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:49 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 49 sq.</bibl> (called Romulus Silvius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n41080.2" n="II" level="1"> For <hi rend="ital">Remus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sat. 19</bibl>; cf. 2. Remus.—</sense><sense id="n41080.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of fictitious heroes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 360</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">593</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">633</bibl>; 11, 636; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:186" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remundo: <entryFree id="n41081" type="gloss" key="re^mundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Veron. 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remuneratio: <entryFree id="n41082" type="main" key="re^mu_ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmūnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>remuneror</etym>, <sense id="n41082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remuneration</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">expeditior et celerior remuneratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">RAT. S. R., i. e. rationalis sacrarum remunerationum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1090</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SANCTARVM REMVNERATIONVM PER TRIENNIVM COMES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remunerator: <entryFree id="n41083" type="main" key="re^mu_ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmūnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that repays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recompenses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rewarder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompenser</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 36</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIRTVTVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remuneratrix: <entryFree id="n41084" type="main" key="re^mu_ne^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmūnĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>remunerator</etym>, <sense id="n41084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that repays</hi> or <hi rend="ital">avenges</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Psa. 118, 14, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cant. Cantic. 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
remunero: <entryFree id="n41085" type="main" key="re^mu_ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmūnĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. remuneror <sense id="n41085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
remuneror: <entryFree id="n41086" type="main" key="re^mu_ne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-mūnĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n41086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remunerate</hi> (class.; syn. retribuo). </sense><sense id="n41086.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Aliquem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem munere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem magno praemio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9:38" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9, 38</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te his suppliciis remunerabor,</quote> <trans><tr>punish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41086.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Aliquid: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus autem officiis T. Annii beneficii remunerabor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi remunerans meritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sophisma,</quote> <trans><tr>to refute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of an inanim. subject: quod (solum) impensam coloni laboremque<cb n="RENA" />  magno fetu remuneratur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41086.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam esse gratiam tantam, quam non vel capere animus meus in accipiendo vel in remunerando cumulare atque illustrare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi ad remunerandum nihil suppetat praeter voluntatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">remunerandi voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 161</bibl></cit>.?*! </sense><sense id="n41086.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmūnĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille puellae artificium pari motu remunerabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si laborem dominus remunerare voluerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41086.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi statuis et salariis remunerantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remuneratus est a me mutuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim obligandus sed remunerandus est in amoris officio qui prior coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remuria: <entryFree id="n41087" type="gloss" key="re^mu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmūrĭa</orth>. <sense id="n41087.0" n="1" level="3"> = ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmōrĭa</orth>, v. remurinus.<orth extent="full" lang="la">—</orth>; </sense><sense id="n41087.1" n="2" level="3"> = ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕmūrĭa</orth>, v. h. v.</sense></entryFree>
remurinus: <entryFree id="n41088" type="gloss" key="remuri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">remurīnus</orth> <itype>ager dictus, qui possessus est a Remo</itype>, et habitatio Remi Remorima. Sed et locus in summo Aventino Remoria dicitur, ubi Remus de urbe condendā fuerat auspicatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=276" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 276</bibl> and 277 Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> ib.; cf. <sense id="n41088.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Müll. p. 402: eundem locum (Remus) ex suo nomine Remuriam appellarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. Rom. 23" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. Rom. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remurmuratio: <entryFree id="n41089" type="main" key="re^murmu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕmurmŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>re-murmuro</etym>, <sense id="n41089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a murmuring back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 37, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
remurmuro: <entryFree id="n41090" type="main" key="re^murmu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-murmŭro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n41090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to murmur back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remurmur</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n41090.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41090.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remurmurat unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus remurmurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:153" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 153</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41090.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina remurmurat echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:28" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 28</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41090.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to murmur back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis quid remurmurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Amic. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
remus: <entryFree id="n41091" type="main" key="re_mus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)retmo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n41091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41091.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut retinet navis cursum, intermisso impetu pulsuque remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remis navem incitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 25: remis contendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incumbere remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remis insurgere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 207</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">560: inpellere aequora remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 657</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: remis velisque, velis remisque, remis ventisque; also, ventis remis, <hi rend="ital">with sails and oars</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with all one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s might</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with all possible speed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita citi remis velisque impellite puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:568" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res omni contentione, velis, ut ita dicam, remisque fugienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevam cuncta cohors remis ventisque petivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde ventis remis in patriam omni festinatione properavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remigio veloque festinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n41091.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of the wings of birds: <cit><quote lang="la">alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum (Icari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:98" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 98</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the hands and feet of a swimmer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 215</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41091.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerebam, utrum panderem vela orationis statim, an eam ante paululum dialecticorum remis propellerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit> (shortly before, remigare; opp. vela facere).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41092" type="main" key="Re^mus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the brother of Romulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 533</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 464</bibl>.—In the poets, as the ancestor of the Romans, instead of the more usual Romulus: <cit><quote lang="la">glubit magnanimos Remi nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 58, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 73</bibl></cit> Rupert.: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:76:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 76, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna prima Remi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">culmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 80.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41093" type="main" key="Re_mus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rēmus</orth>, v. Remi, I.</entryFree>
ren: <entryFree id="n41094" type="main" key="re_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēn</orth>, <itype>rēnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, only in <number>plur.</number> renes, q. v.</entryFree>
renalis: <entryFree id="n41095" type="main" key="re_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>renes</etym>, <sense id="n41095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the kidneys</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renancitur: <entryFree id="n41096" type="gloss" key="renanci^tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">renancĭtur</orth> significat reprehendit. Unde adhuc nos dicimus nanciscitur et nactus id est adeptus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=276" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 276</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=277" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 277</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
renarro: <entryFree id="n41097" type="main" key="re^narro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-narro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tell over again; to tell of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fata divom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 635</bibl></cit> Bach.: <cit><quote lang="la">priora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebas Argosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:390" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 390</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renascibilitas: <entryFree id="n41098" type="main" key="re^nasci^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnascĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>renascor</etym>, <sense id="n41098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a regeneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new birth</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Inc. Qu. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Test. 50" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> Test. 50</bibl>. <cb n="RENI" /></sense></entryFree>
renascor: <entryFree id="n41099" type="main" key="re^nascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nascor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n41099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be born again; to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">spring up again</hi> (class.; cf. regeneror). </sense><sense id="n41099.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res quaeque ... De niloque renata forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 674</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:757" default="NO" valid="yes">757</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore de patrio parvus phoenix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex se ipsa phoenix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te Pythagorae fallant arcana renati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut revixisse aut renatum sibi quisque Scipionem imperatorem dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi qui mihi pinnas inciderant, nolunt easdem renasci. Sed, ut spero, jam renascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dente renato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 23, § 47</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41099.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come forth again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">spring up again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ab stirpibus laetius feraciusque renatae urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot nascentia templa, tot renata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi terreno Lycus (fluvius) est epotus hiatu, Exsistit procul hinc alioque renascitur orbe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>comes forth again</tr>, <tr>reappears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen fonte novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 262</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41099.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be renewed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium exstinctum nec ipsum ab alio renascetur, nec ex se aliud creabit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum renatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum ex integro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa (vocabula) renascentur, quae jam cecidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae renascens Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 862" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 862</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2352</bibl>. — Esp., </sense><sense id="n41099.4" n="B" level="2"> (In eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">To be renewed</hi> in heart, <hi rend="ital">to be born again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 1, 23.</sense></entryFree>
renatus: <entryFree id="n41100" type="main" key="re^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n41100.0" n="1" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from reno. <orth extent="full" lang="la">—</orth>;</sense><sense id="n41100.1" n="2" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood>, from renascor.</sense></entryFree>
re: <entryFree id="n41101" type="main" key="re^2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail back.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41101.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post in haec Puteolana et Cumana regna renavigaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Asturā Antium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Indiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41101.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron invius Renavigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 716" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 716</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renecto: <entryFree id="n41102" type="hapax" key="re^necto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-necto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to connect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ali. quem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 474</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reneo: <entryFree id="n41103" type="main" key="re^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unspin</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to undo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unravel</hi> what had been spun (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">at Clymenus Clothoque dolent, haec fila reneri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that the destiny is reversed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:757" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 757</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcarum fila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:171" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 171</bibl></cit> (dub.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fila manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:444" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 444</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renes: <entryFree id="n41104" type="main" key="re_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēnes</orth>, <itype>renum</itype> (renium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 29, 103, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 27</bibl>, §§ 98 and 102; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 125" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:143" default="NO">143</bibl>. — <sense id="n41104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēn</orth>, not used. — Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rien</orth>, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=276" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 276</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 24</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 645</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">fre/nes;</foreign> cf. Lid. and Scott, s. v. <foreign lang="greek">frh/n</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n41104.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The kidneys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 81, § 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">renum vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umores, qui ex renibus profunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">renes morbo temptantur acuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 28 al.</bibl> — * </sense><sense id="n41104.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The loins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 112</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41104.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">the seat of the affections</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:138:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 138, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reniculus: <entryFree id="n41105" type="hapax" key="re_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ren, renes</etym>, <sense id="n41105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kidney</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
renidentia: <entryFree id="n41106" type="hapax" key="re^ni_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnīdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>renideo</etym>, <sense id="n41106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a smile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renideo: <entryFree id="n41107" type="main" key="re^ni_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nīdĕo</orth> (<sense id="n41107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> reniduit, <foreign lang="greek">e)meidi/asen,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ni/zw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to shine again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine back; to glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resplendent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and not freq. till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n41107.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec domus argento fulgenti auroque renidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pura nocturno renidet Luna mari Gnidiusve Gyges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ebur neque aureum Meā renidet in domo lacunar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa orichalca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:660" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrum, Petr. poët. 119, 29: circum renidentes Lares,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shining from the reflection of the fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:66" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: late fluctuat omnis Aere renidenti tellus, <hi rend="ital">with gleaming brass</hi> (of arms), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 282</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aere renidescit tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 326</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n41107.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n41107.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sola renidet in Stilichone salus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 501</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41107.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beam for joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be glad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puer Icarus) ore renidenti Captabat plumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:234" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 234</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractabat ceram puer pennasque renidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:A. A. 2:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:789" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 789</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarior protinus renidet oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, as cause of the joy: adjecisse praedam Torquibus exiguis<pb n="1565" /> <cb n="RENO" />  renidet, <hi rend="ital">rejoices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41107.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (by a natural figure, as, conversely, ridere is used <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for splendere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 6 al.</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to smile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laugh</hi> (syn. subrideo): <cit><quote lang="la">homo renidens,</quote> <trans><tr>smiling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec renidens Milo ... inquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius torvus aut falsum renidens vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">torvum renidens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">renidenti cohibens suspiria vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:359" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cupido) Iste lascivus puer ac renidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 277" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Egnatius quod candidos habet dentes, Renidet usquequaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>— * </sense><sense id="n41107.6" n="b" level="4"> With <case>dat.</case> (like arridere), <hi rend="ital">to smile upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be gracious to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi renidens Fortuna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renidesco: <entryFree id="n41108" type="main" key="re^ni_desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnīdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [renideo], <hi rend="ital">to grow bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota circum Aere (i. e. armis) renidescit tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 326</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renisus: <entryFree id="n41109" type="main" key="re^ni_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>renitor</etym>, <sense id="n41109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resistance</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 16.</sense></entryFree>
renitenter: <entryFree id="n41110" type="main" key="re^ni_tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnītenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Lib. Arbit. 3:69" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Lib. Arbit. 3, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reniteo: <entryFree id="n41111" type="main" key="re^ni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nĭtĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flash</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ambros. de Fide, 2, 14 al.</sense></entryFree>
renitor: <entryFree id="n41112" type="main" key="re^ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nītor</orth>, <itype>nīti</itype>, <sense id="n41112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">struggle against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withstand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.; syn.: resisto, adversor, reluctor). </sense><sense id="n41112.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam alter motus alteri renititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 82, 84, § 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:222" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 42, 81, § 222</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">os (specillo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41112.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi renitentes pactos dicerent sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">renitentibus vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo renitente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 13, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reno: <entryFree id="n41113" type="main" key="re^no" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-no</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swim back</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">per Stygias aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:432" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul imis saxa renarint Vadis levata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shall float back to the surface</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 25</bibl></cit>: eodem renato stagno, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 17.† † </sense><sense id="n41113.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēno</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhēno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a reindeer-skin</hi>, as a garment of the ancient Germans, <hi rend="ital">a fur pelisse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">renones sunt velamina umerorum et pectoris usque ad umbilicum atque intortis villis adeo hispida, ut imbrem respuant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Germani) pellibus aut parvis rhenonum tegimentis utuntur (i. e. rhenonibus quae sunt parva tegimenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (v. Kraner ad h. l.); cf.: Germani intectum renonibus corpus tegunt, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. Isid. l. l.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 383</bibl>. —Acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll., <hi rend="ital">a Gallic dress</hi>: sagum reno Gallica (vestimenta).</sense></entryFree>
renodis: <entryFree id="n41114" type="hapax" key="re^no_dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nōdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nodus</etym>, <sense id="n41114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renodo: <entryFree id="n41115" type="main" key="re^no_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nōdo</orth>, no <sense id="n41115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n41115.1" n="I" level="1"> (Like religo, I.) <hi rend="ital">To bind back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind</hi> ( = in nodum colligere): <cit><quote lang="la">longam comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; v. Dillenb. and Orell. ad h. l. —</sense><sense id="n41115.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To untie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>: teque (Dianam) renodatam pharetris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">released from your quiver</hi> ( = quae solvit et deposuit umero pharetram), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:381" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 381</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
renormatus: <entryFree id="n41116" type="main" key="re^norma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-normātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [normo], <sense id="n41116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arranged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laid out anew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. p. 104" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. p. 104</bibl></cit> and 137 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
renosco: <entryFree id="n41117" type="hapax" key="re^nosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nosco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to recognize</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15, 342</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
renovamen: <entryFree id="n41118" type="hapax" key="re^no^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnŏvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>renovo</etym>, <sense id="n41118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum Forma ... in hoc renovamine mansit,</quote> <trans><tr>in that new condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 731</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renovatio: <entryFree id="n41119" type="main" key="re^no^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnŏvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41119.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a renewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 3, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41119.1" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in business lang., <hi rend="ital">a renewing of interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compound interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confeceram, ut solverent, centesimis sexennii ductis cum renovatione singulorum annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41119.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renovativum: <entryFree id="n41120" type="gloss" key="re^no^va_ti_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnŏvātīvum</orth> <itype>fulgur vocatur, cum ex aliquo fulgure functio fieri coepit, si factum est simile fulgur, quod idem significet</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=289" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 289</bibl> Muüll.</entryFree>
renovator: <entryFree id="n41121" type="gloss" key="re^no^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnŏvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>renovo</etym>, <sense id="n41121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renovator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">OPERVM PVBLICORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renovello: <entryFree id="n41122" type="main" key="re^no^vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nŏvello</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to renew</hi>: vineam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to plant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set anew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
renovo: <entryFree id="n41123" type="main" key="re^no^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nŏvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: instauro, redintegro). </sense><sense id="n41123.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: marc fontes<cb n="RENU" />  assidue renovant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 591</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (vaporibus) altae renovataeque stellae atque omnis aether refundunt eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucifer renovatus undā Oceani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:639" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides Virtutis templum a M. Marcello renovatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIAS ET MILLIARIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 905</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renovare veteres colonias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durum arvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to renew by ploughing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus renovatur campus aratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa jugera (tauri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; but also, <hi rend="ital">to restore by not cultivating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let lie fallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedeat praeterea cottidie ad rationes, tabulasque testamenti omnibus renovet,</quote> <trans><tr>retouch</tr>, <tr>change</tr>, <tr>alter before everybody</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ulixem) veteres arcus leto renovasse procorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>used again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> (4, 11), 35.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si Neptuni fluctu renovare operam des (sc.: purpureum colorem conchyli),</quote> <trans><tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1076" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1076</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41123.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in business lang., <hi rend="ital">to renew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">redouble interest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to take interest on interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take compound interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaptius centesimis renovato in singulos annos faenore, contentus non fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. renovatio, I. 2.— </sense><sense id="n41123.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum sit, ne instauratas maximi belli reliquias ac renovatas audiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus renovare et instaurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem animi curam molestiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo eam rem commemorando renovare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infandum, regina, jubes renovare dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam prope intermortuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquarum cladium memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona praeterita gratā recordatione renovata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristina bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli renovandi consilium capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:209" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra rite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam et societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 465</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:472" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renovata clades domūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:243" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam doloremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia (with redintegrare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos Anchisae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to restore his youth</tr>, <tr>make him young again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:215" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem aetatis ex morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos renovaverat Titan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:113" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 113</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41123.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41123.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To repeat</hi> in words, <hi rend="ital">say again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say repeatedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic renovabo illud, quod initio dixi, regnum comparari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut renovetur, non redintegretur oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lege, de foedere, etc.... renovabo ea quae dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 7</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(consules) ipsis tribunis (plebis) ut sacrosancti viderentur, renovarunt,</quote> <trans><tr>declared anew</tr>, <tr>repeated</tr>, <tr>that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit> Drak.— </sense><sense id="n41123.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To renew in strength; to refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recreate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">recreare, reficere): quies renovavit corpora animosque ad omnia de integro patienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum auditoris ad ea quae restant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos equitum ad alicujus odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, quae risum judicis movendo ... animum aliquando reficit et a satietate vel a fatigatione renovat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refici atque renovari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars variandi renovat aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigata (facundia) renovatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et virium plus afferunt ad discendum renovati ac recentes,</quote> <trans><tr>restored and fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renovato modica quiete exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se novis opibus copiisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi mihi locus optimi illius viri desiderium renovavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renubo: <entryFree id="n41124" type="main" key="re^nu_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nūbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to marry again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
renudo: <entryFree id="n41125" type="main" key="re^nu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to uncover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make naked; to bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strip</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia umero tenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam laciniis cunctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 122, 9; <cit><quote lang="la">8, p. 215, 37: tectum, parietes, januas,</quote> <trans><tr>to uncover</tr>, <tr>open</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coronam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>. <cb n="RENU" /></sense></entryFree>
