renudus: <entryFree id="n41126" type="hapax" key="re^nu_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 17</bibl> (others, nudae).</sense></entryFree>
renumero: <entryFree id="n41127" type="main" key="re^nu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (anteand post-class.). <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n41127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to count over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count up.</hi> — Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to pay back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem pecuniam patri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renunculus: <entryFree id="n41128" type="main" key="re_nuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēnuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ren</etym>, <sense id="n41128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kidney</hi> (only in <number>plur.</number> and late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
renuntiatio: <entryFree id="n41129" type="main" key="re^nunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnuntĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕnunc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>renuntio</etym>. <sense id="n41129.0" n="I" level="1"> Publicists' and jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announcement</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 34, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesio renuntiat, se dedisse: cognoscite renuntiationem ex litteris publicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">89: suffragiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eundem esse ordinem dignitatis et renuntiationis (sc. magistratus), propterea quod renuntiatio gradus habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:77:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interest nostrā, ne fallamur in modi renuntiatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41129.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giving notice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warning</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluntate distrahitur societas renuntiatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:63" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:65:section=3" default="NO">17, 2, 65, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6 al" default="NO">6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
renuntiator: <entryFree id="n41130" type="main" key="re^nunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnuntĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕnunc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaimer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum nostrorum renuntiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositionis infernae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erroris tui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
renuntio: <entryFree id="n41131" type="main" key="re^nunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕnuncĭo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n41131.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry back word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41131.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare and mostly ante-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. refero): quid nunc renuntiem abs te responsum, Chreme?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc alii mihi renuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nihil a quoquam renuntiabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>no answer was brought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque ad patrem esse mortuum renuntiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec quae tibi renuntiantur, filium te velle circumducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi non tibi renuntiata sint haec, sic fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandro regi renuntiatam adeo divitem (insulam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is me nunc renuntiare repudium jussit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberet renuntietque hodie mihi, Velintne annon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc metuebam, ne meae Uxori renuntiaret de pallā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 18</bibl>: posteaquam mihi renuntiatum est de obitu Tulliae filiae tuae, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi renuntiari sic me habere in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi et renuntia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus abiisse aiebant, nunc domum renuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi renuntiatum est, quibus credo satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41131.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., publicists' and jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to state officially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. indico): legati ex auctoritate haec Caesari renuntiant, Intelligere se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volusenus perspectis regionibus ... ad Caesarem revertitur quaeque ibi perspexisset, renuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roscius postulata Caesaris renuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesari renuntiaverunt, pulverem majorem in eā parte videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar cognoscit Considium timore perterritum, quod non vidisset, pro viso sibi renuntiasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ille vir legationem renuntiare potuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had been able to give an account of his mission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">legationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 32</bibl>; 36, 35; 39, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 20 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dicta legatis renuntiataque in consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc imperant pullario: ille renuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum renuntiata essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiat collegae facturum se quod is censeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni revocaturos se easdem tribus renuntiarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium numerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta et imperia tua domum ad senatum suum renuntiaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:31:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 31, § 73</bibl></cit>.— Esp. of the official announcement of an election (either by the praeco or the presiding magistrate), <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">announce elected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make the return</hi>: coepti sunt a praecone renuntiari, quem quaeque <pb n="1566" /> <cb n="REOR" /> tribus fecerint aedilem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset praetor renuntiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum propter dilationem comitiorum ter praetor primus centuriis cunctis renuntiatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo modo sacerdos Climarchias renuntiatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (magistratus) priusquam renuntiarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hostis renuntiaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>declared a public enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Jul. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator comitia consularia habuit aemulumque decoris sui absentem M. Valerium Corvum consulem renuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:92:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 92, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8</bibl>, ext. 3: renuntiare repudium, v. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n41131.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentior vero renuntioque vobis, nihil esse, quod adhuc de re publicā dictum putemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41131.4" n="C" level="2"> Renuntiare sibi, <hi rend="ital">to report to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impress on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own mind</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">reflect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>: qui renuntient sibi, quanta sit humani ingenii vis, quam potens efficiendi, quae velit, <hi rend="ital">represent to themselves</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">potest et illa res a luctu te prohibere nimio, si tibi ipse renuntiaveris, nihil horum, quae facis, posse subduco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Polyb. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Polyb. 6</bibl></cit> (25), 1.—</sense><sense id="n41131.5" n="II" level="1"> (<hi rend="ital">Re</hi> negative or qs. rejecting.) <hi rend="ital">To retract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse; to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renounce</hi> (good prose): <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Ad cenam hercle alio promisi foras. <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Jube domi cenam coqui Atque ad illum renuntiari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiari extemplo amicis, quos in consilium rogaverat, imperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illi ad prandium promisissem, and prandium renuntiassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: incensus hospitium ei renuntiat; <cit><quote lang="la">domo ejus emigrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem et amicitiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">societatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiat Habonius illam decisionem tutoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 16</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid imprudentius publicanis renuntiantibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo ingemuit, etc.... pedem nemo in illo judicio supplosit, credo, ne Stoicis renuntiaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilibus officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:59:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:19:65:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 19, 65, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renuntius: <entryFree id="n41132" type="main" key="re^nunti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnuntĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>renuntio</etym>, <sense id="n41132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who brings back intelligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reporter</hi> (anteand post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 22</bibl>; Cod. Th. 3, 7, 1.</sense></entryFree>
renuo: <entryFree id="n41133" type="main" key="re^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [nuo, whence nutum; abnuo], <hi rend="ital">to nod back the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deny by a motion of the head; to deny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disapprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, = recusare (rare before the Aug. per.; syn.: abnuo, abnego). </sense><sense id="n41133.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuit negitatque Sabellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuit Tiberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuenti et gestu in aliud tempus differenti (Caesari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuente deo,</quote> <trans><tr>against the will of the god</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 325</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 14, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fato renuente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:49" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere me tamen hoc oculo renuente negavi,</quote> <trans><tr>with an incredulous eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 89</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerunt hic modo nobiscum ad haec subsellia: quibus superciliis renuentes huic decem millium crimini!</quote> <trans><tr>they deny this charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem Subrio Flavio annuenti an destringeret gladium renuit infregitque impetus,</quote> <trans><tr>checked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocavi et renuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41133.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuis tu quod jubet alter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <trans><tr>to decline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: nec laudem Danai tanto renuere labori, <hi rend="ital">refused</hi>, Sabin. 1, 27: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga renuit curari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 15, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renuto: <entryFree id="n41134" type="main" key="re^nu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n41134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [renuo], <hi rend="ital">to decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 600</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 774</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
renutrio: <entryFree id="n41135" type="hapax" key="re^nutri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-nutrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nourish again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 23, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
renutus: <entryFree id="n41136" type="hapax" key="re^nu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕnūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>renuo</etym>, <sense id="n41136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusal;</hi> a word formed by Pliny the Younger, for the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">a)ne/neusen</foreign> (Il. 16, 250): <cit><quote lang="la">ego quoque simili nutu ac renutu respondere voto tuo possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reor: <entryFree id="n41137" type="main" key="re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕor</orth>, <itype>rătus, 2</itype> (2 <sense id="n41137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pers. pres.</hi> rere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 381</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 49</bibl>: <cb n="REOR" /> reris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 134</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. rta, correct; Zend, areta, complete; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)reth/,</foreign> valor]. </sense><sense id="n41137.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculate;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—Hence, by a usual transfer (like censere, putare, existimare, etc.),—</sense><sense id="n41137.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deem</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the poets; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cæs.: horridum reor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: opinor, arbitror, credo, censeo). </sense><sense id="n41137.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc servi esse officium reor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">reor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 273</bibl>; 370; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 394</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 438</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 505</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9 al.</bibl>: reris and rere, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">retur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; Grex. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 37</bibl>; 40, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">rebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 690</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3</bibl>; Fur. 303" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. lang="la">rear,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rearis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:114" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 114</bibl>; 247; 6, 536 al.: reare, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:617:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 617, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 952</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 78</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 764: reantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 26 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 674</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 841 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes">55, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO">12, 10, 5</bibl> et saep. al.—</sense><sense id="n41137.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos quidem plures, quam rebar, esse cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam illud mali plus nobis vivit quam ratae (sc. sumus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reor a facie, Calliopea fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 38: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rebare, Venus (nec te sententia fallit) Trojanas sustentat opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut potius reor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque, ut ipse rebatur viam suāpte naturā difficilem inexpugnabilem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam, reor, non ullis, si vita longior daretur, posset esse jucundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ră-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed by calculation;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valid</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod modo erat ratum inritumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (7), 58: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quod egissem esset ratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rata et certa spatia definire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus (stellarum) constantes et rati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrorum rati immutabilesque cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 38, 97: si nihil fieri potest, nisi quod ab omni aeternitate certum fuerit esse futurum rato tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussum ratum atque firmum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum stabile, fixum, ratum esse debeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud certum, ratum, firmum, fixum vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorias subscriptiones omnes fixas et in perpetuum ratas putet esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 132</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut amicitia societasque nostra in aeternum rata sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus tribunatus si ratus est, nihil est, quod irritum possit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so, opp. irritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ratosne habeant an vanos pectoris orsus, id. poët. Div. 2, 30, 63: testamenta (opp. rupta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi comitia ne essent rata, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Faustae, cui cautum ille voluisset, ratum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: neque ratum est quod dicas, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerat idque ratum Stygii per flumina Annuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A, 9, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec Turno rata vita maneret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rata sint sua visa precatur,</quote> <trans><tr>may be fulfilled</tr>, <tr>accomplished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 702</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 474</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 815</bibl>; 3, 341; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15</bibl> (16), 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:696" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 696</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 5, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(ebrietas) spes jubet esse ratas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides et vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:488" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 488</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: beneficia ratissima atque gratissima, Cato ap. Fest. pp. 286 and 287 Müll. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of a person: occiduntur: ubi potitur ratu' Romulu' praedam, <hi rend="ital">the resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi> (syn. certus), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=274" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 274</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 78 Vahl.). <cb n="REPA" /> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n41137.5" n="B" level="2"> In particular connections. </sense><sense id="n41137.6" n="1" level="3"> Pro ratā parte (portione), secundum ratam partem, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, pro ratā, <hi rend="ital">according to a certain part</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportionally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus agros ex suis possessionibus pollicetur, quaterna in singulos jugera, et pro ratā parte centurionibus evocatisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro ratā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde ut cuique data sunt pro ratā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam ex omni senatu pro rata parte esset!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumam partem relinqui placet, si plenae fuerint alvi, si minus, pro ratā portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">item secundum ratam partem ex altitudine columnarum expediendae sunt altitudines epistyliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum pediti daturum fuisse credunt, et pro ratā aliis, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 7</bibl>, and often in the Digests.—</sense><sense id="n41137.7" n="2" level="3"> Ratum aliquid facere (efficere) habere, ducere, also ratum alicui esse, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">account</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">valid; to confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve</hi>: quid augur (habet), cur a dextrā corvus a sinistrā cornix faciat ratum? <hi rend="ital">make a confirmatory</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a favorable augury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens nati rata verba Fecit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fulfilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes cum avum regem salutassent, secuta ex omni multitudine consentiens vox ratum nomen imperiumque regi effecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiant ratas, utraque diva preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:696" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nobis imperatores commoda tribuerunt, ea rata atque perpetua auctoritate vestrā faciatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 16</bibl></cit>: eos ratum habere judicium, si totum corruptum sit; <cit><quote lang="la">si unus accusator corruptus sit, rescindere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:36:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ratum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 10</bibl>: Atteius Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(fata) ratosne habeant an vanos pectoris orsus, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 63: cavere de rato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:6:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 6, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non duxerint societatem ratam, ubi nec divini quicquam nec humani sanctum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista ipsa, quae te emisse scribis, non solum rata mihi erunt, sed etiam grata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely, ratum servare: quaeris an quod gessit ratum servum. Ego vero servo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.?*! In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl>, for the corrupted curata auctoritas eventu of the MS., read cum rato auctoritas eventu; v. Weissenb. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
repages: <entryFree id="n41138" type="gloss" key="re^pa_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpāges</orth>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, = repagula, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=281" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 281</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
repagula: <entryFree id="n41139" type="main" key="re^pa_gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pāgŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pag, pango, that which is thrust back again</etym>, <sense id="n41139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bolts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bars</hi> of a door. </sense><sense id="n41139.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">occludite aedes pessulis, repagulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvae clausae repagulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convulsis repagulis (templi) effractisque valvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola Venus portae cecidisse repagula sensit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 783</bibl></cit>: pedibusque repagula pulsant, 2, 155; 5, 120; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:318" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 318</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 295</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n41139.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restraints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limits</hi>: repagula, quibus ego iram omnem recludam, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia repagula juris pudoris officiique perfringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repandirostrus: <entryFree id="n41140" type="hapax" key="re^pandi^rostrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpandĭ-rostrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repandus-rostrum</etym>, <sense id="n41140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a turned-up snout</hi>: pecus Nerei, <hi rend="ital">the dolphins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sea-calves</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repando: <entryFree id="n41141" type="main" key="re^pando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pando</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to open again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 150, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 226, 20.</sense></entryFree>
repandus: <entryFree id="n41142" type="main" key="re^pandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n41142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned up</hi> (syn.: recurvus, reduncus): lascivire pecus . . . rostrique repandum, <hi rend="ital">with turned-up snouts</hi> (dolphins, seacalves), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 159, 1</bibl> (cf. repandirostrus): <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum (delphini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repandus (delphinus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura Socratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repango: <entryFree id="n41143" type="main" key="re^pango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pango</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen ferulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
reparabilis: <entryFree id="n41144" type="main" key="re^pa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpărābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reparo</etym>, <sense id="n41144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be repaired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restored</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">regained; retrievable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reparable</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not anteAug.): damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesa pudicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:562" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl>: ales phoenix, i. e. <hi rend="ital">coming</hi> <pb n="1567" /> <cb n="REPA" /> <hi rend="ital">to life again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 18, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">echo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>repeating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:102" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41144.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Always ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reparabilis gentis motus infidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarique ut reparabiles semper et celeres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reparatio: <entryFree id="n41145" type="main" key="re^pa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reparo</etym>, <sense id="n41145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">THERMARVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reparator: <entryFree id="n41146" type="main" key="re^pa^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renovator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORBIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reparco: <entryFree id="n41147" type="main" key="re^parco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-parco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-perco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be sparing with</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to spare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refrain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abstain from</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utinam a principio rei pepercisses meae, Ut nunc repercis saviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit> (where Speng. conjectures repercisses): ex nullā facere id si parte reparcent, <hi rend="ital">if they in no way refrain from doing</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">believing</hi>) <hi rend="ital">this</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 667</bibl> Munro: <cit><quote lang="la">istius muneris operam non reparcam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:33" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reparo: <entryFree id="n41148" type="main" key="re^pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-păro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">procure again; to recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrieve; to restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cæs.; cf.: recupero, redimo, reficio). </sense><sense id="n41148.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">id perdere videbatur, quod alio praetore eodem ex agro reparare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 199</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reparare quod amiseris gravius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod amittitur non parvo sumptu reparatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1037" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1037</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecas incendio absumptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 20</bibl></cit>: Academiae villam, Laurea Tullius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta Trojae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublapsa aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 70</bibl></cit> (75), 1 (Keil, relaxentur): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos, si effluxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 111, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegerrime ignem dimissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud ex aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:965" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 965</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliis alias figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova cornua (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populos artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:363" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 363</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41148.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to procure by exchange; to purchase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> with something: <cit><quote lang="la">vina Syrā reparata merce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios boves his nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:122" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41148.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41148.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciam potestatem, rem intermissam, reparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intermissam historias scribendi industriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45</bibl></cit> Drak.; 24, 42 (with instaurare); 30, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:9" default="NO">22, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:7" default="NO">24, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinam fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41148.5" n="B" level="2"> Of loss or damage, <hi rend="ital">to make good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phaedr. 476" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phaedr. 476</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 71, 8</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41148.6" n="C" level="2"> Like reficere, recreare, <hi rend="ital">to refresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam assiduus in tribunali, ut labore refici ac reparari videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:77:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 77, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attrita cottidiano actu forensi ingenia optime rerum talium blanditiā reparantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (quies) reparat vires, fessaque membra novat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas novi exercitūs vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respublica per Augustum reparata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> C. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea fessa Membra reparat labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora fessa reparas labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:625" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars magna terrarum (Aegypti) mergi repararique amne consueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (Cleopatra) latentes Classe citā reparavit oras ( = alias sibi parare studuit regiones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Orell. ad h. l.: PATRIOS PENATES ( = repetere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidos meatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reparturiens: <entryFree id="n41149" type="main" key="re^partu^ri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-partŭrĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [parturio], <sense id="n41149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing forth again</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 6, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repasco: <entryFree id="n41150" type="main" key="re^pasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nourish again</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">divitem impendiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 44, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 21, 853</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repastinatio: <entryFree id="n41151" type="main" key="re^pasti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpastĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repastino</etym>. <sense id="n41151.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, agricult. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a digging up again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fossiones agri repastinationesque proferam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n41151.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a revising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
repastino: <entryFree id="n41152" type="main" key="re^pasti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pastĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (old <sense id="n41152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> repastinassere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Com. 288" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Com. 288</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n41152.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, agricult. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to dig again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delve anew; to dig around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grub</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:37:4" default="NO">1, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:3" default="NO">4, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 11, § 61 al.</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 137 and 231.— </sense><sense id="n41152.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <cb n="REPE" /> <hi rend="ital">to clean</hi> (post-class.). <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41152.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: usum divitiarum, <hi rend="ital">to check</hi>, = coercere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to renew</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissionem injuriae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to prevent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repatrio: <entryFree id="n41153" type="main" key="re^patri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-patrĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to return to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go home again</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum multi captivorum intacti repatriaverint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ad Pelusium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Romanum imperium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repecto: <entryFree id="n41154" type="main" key="re^pecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pecto</orth>, no <sense id="n41154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to comb again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comb</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jubas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:418" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liquidos fontes se barba repectit, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 222: coma repexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 154</bibl></cit>: crinis, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 240.</sense></entryFree>
repedabilis: <entryFree id="n41155" type="hapax" key="re^pe^da_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpĕdābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repedo</etym>, <sense id="n41155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">giving way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding</hi>: arbor, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:266" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 266</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repedo: <entryFree id="n41156" type="main" key="re^pe^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pĕdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n41156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">step back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recoil</hi> (anteand post-class.): repedare, recedere, Fest. pp. 280 and 281 Müll.: redisse ac repedasse, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 165, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 165, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad signa repedavit ocius miles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amplius ausa repedavit ad sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 12, 37</bibl>. — With homogeneous object: gradum a vestibulo, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280</bibl> Müll. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1280</bibl>, the correct reading is trepidabat; v. Lachm. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
repello: <entryFree id="n41157" type="main" key="re^pello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pello</orth>, <itype>reppuli</itype> (less correctly repuli), <itype>rĕpulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thrust back; to reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>, etc., = reicere (freq. and class.; syn.: reicio, repono, removeo). </sense><sense id="n41157.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ego meis Dictis malis his foribus atque hac reppuli, rejeci hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus tam saepe repulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines inermos armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarius, qui sit et feriendus et repellendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab hoc templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines a templi aditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinos a moenibus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes a ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ab castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a citeriore ripā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4:10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes in silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oppidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri acriter in eos impetu facto, repulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17</bibl></cit>. —Of impersonal objects (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">reppulit mihi manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum aere repulsum,</quote> <trans><tr>repelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas,</quote> <trans><tr>to push back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 661</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repagula,</quote> <trans><tr>to shove back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem mediā undā,</quote> <trans><tr>crowds back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem a terrā, Auct. B. Alex. 20: serpentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the apparent pushing back or away of the starting-point, in flying up or sailing away: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani spretos pede reppulit amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 233</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito juvenis, pedibus tellure repulsā, Arduus in nubes abiit,</quote> <trans><tr>spurning the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impressā tellurem reppulit hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:786" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 786</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 512: aera repulsa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cymbals struck together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:22" default="NO">1, 8, 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aera Aere repulsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 533</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41157.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove; to keep off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulse</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">repelli oratorem a gubernaculis civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc conatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a cognitione legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab impediendo ac laedendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 14:55" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac spe repulsi Nervii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsum ab amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracti bello fatisque repulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsus ille veritatis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc quoque repulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per colloquia repulsus a Lepido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 1</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of suitors for office,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud repulsus abibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 32</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of lovers: saepe roges aliquid, saepe repulsus eas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit> (12): <cit><quote lang="la">proci repulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam ad meretricium quaestum,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of abstract objects: dolorem a se repellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores Clodii a cervicibus vestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius alterum consulatum a re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tamen a verā longe ratione repulsum'st,</quote> <trans><tr>removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 880</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 645</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:406" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 406</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegimenta ad defendendos ictus ac repellendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
