C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 767</bibl>: cute ictus, <cb n="REPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 79, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim (opp. inferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen (with transferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temptamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:777" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver hiemem repellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia nostra,</quote> <trans><tr>to reject</tr>, <tr>disdain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 214</bibl></cit> amorem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diadema,</quote> <trans><tr>to refuse</tr>, <tr>reject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dictaturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut contumelia repellatur,</quote> <trans><tr>be discarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 137</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">removed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote;</hi> once in Cato: ecquis incultior, religiosior, desertior, publicis negotiis repulsior, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286</bibl>, and ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=287" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 287</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
rependo: <entryFree id="n41158" type="main" key="re^pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh back</hi> (syn. compenso). </sense><sense id="n41158.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aequaque formosae pensa rependis erae,</quote> <trans><tr>you weigh back</tr>, <tr>return by weight</tr>, <tr>the wool weighed out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 41: <cit><quote lang="la">Ravenna ternos (asparagos) libris rependit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>produces them three to the pound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 4, § 54</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41158.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pay with the same weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">with its weight</hi> in money. </sense><sense id="n41158.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cui (Septumuleio) pro C. Gracchi capite erat aurum repensum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 269</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Septumuleius Gai Gracchi auro rependendum caput abscisum ad Opimium tulerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 14, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopico (magneti) laus summa datur, pondusque argento rependitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(balsamum) duplo rependebatur argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 117</bibl></cit>: auro repensus Miles, <hi rend="ital">ransomed</hi> (syn. redemptus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 25</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n41158.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41158.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pay in kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, in a good and bad sense (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hac vitam servatae dote rependis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:694" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2, prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatis contraria fata,</quote> <trans><tr>to balance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 100: <cit><quote lang="la">vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">pro officiis pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pia vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus suum cuique (posteritas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum contra singulos utilitate publicā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 44</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio formae damna,</quote> <trans><tr>to counterbalance</tr>, <tr>compensate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rependere et compensare leve damnum delibatae honestatis majore aliā honestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumitatem turpitudine,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay for</tr>, <tr>purchase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem servitute, donis, Col. praef. § 10: culpam hanc magno terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:744" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis pacta magno luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moestam noctem (with ulcisci socios),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:666" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 666</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n41158.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi> in the mind, <hi rend="ital">to meditate upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui facta rependens, Consilio punire potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repens: <entryFree id="n41159" type="main" key="re_pens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēpens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from repo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41160" type="main" key="re^pens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etymology unknown</etym>. <sense id="n41160.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sudden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlooked for</hi> (class., but less freq. than the deriv. repentinus; for the most part only in <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.;</hi> a favorite word with Liv.; cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne me inparatum cura laceraret repens, Cic. poët. Tusc. 3, 14, 29: hostium adventus (opp. exspectatus, and with maris subita tempestas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Tusc. 3:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventus consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus Attali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fama repens alio avertit bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:220" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singultus vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:360" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 971" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 971</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:91" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consternatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>. — In <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">repenti fulminis ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 400</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41160.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (in Tac.), opp. to earlier, more ancient, i. e. for recens, <hi rend="ital">new</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque discerneres, quid repens aut vetustate obscurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms, <hi rend="ital">suddenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41160.2" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpens</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Janus) Bina repens oculis obtulit ora meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 96</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41160.3" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpentē</orth> (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">abripuit repente sese subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; so (corresp. to subito) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl>: repente exortus<pb n="1568" /> <cb n="REPE" />  sum, repentino occidi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente celeriterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente e vestigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente a tergo signa canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente praeter spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente ex inopinato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctisque repente Improvisus ait,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsa repente (turris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias repente praecidere (opp. sensim dissuere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente collectam auctoritatem tenebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modo egens, repente dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an dolor repente invasit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me repente horum aspectus repressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 39, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjectus conscientiā repente conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum circumfusa repente Scindit se nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 586</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41161" type="main" key="re^pens3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpens</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. repens <sense id="n41161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
repensatio: <entryFree id="n41162" type="hapax" key="re^pensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repenso</etym>, <sense id="n41162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recompense</hi>: vicissitudinis, Salv in Avar. 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
repensatrix: <entryFree id="n41163" type="hapax" key="re^pensa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpensātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repensator</etym>, <sense id="n41163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who recompenses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, 304</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repenso: <entryFree id="n41164" type="main" key="re^penso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpenso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>rependo, II. B.</etym>. <sense id="n41164.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud sacrosanctum caput Tribuni plebis percussoribus auro repensatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl></cit> (dub.).— </sense><sense id="n41164.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make up for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterbalance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">id incommodum uvarum multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merita meritis, injurias injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:32:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem damno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:21:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae legunt, et non intellegunt, Deo repensante patientur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
repensus: <entryFree id="n41165" type="main" key="re^pensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from rependo.</entryFree>
repente: <entryFree id="n41166" type="main" key="re^pente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. repens <sense id="n41166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
repentinaliter: <entryFree id="n41167" type="main" key="re^penti_na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpentīnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>repentinus</etym>, <sense id="n41167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suddenly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repentino: <entryFree id="n41168" type="main" key="re^penti_no_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpentīnō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. repentinus <sense id="n41168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repentinus: <entryFree id="n41169" type="main" key="re^penti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repens</etym>, <sense id="n41169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sudden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlooked for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adventus hostium (opp. exspectatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so (opp. meditata et praeparata) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde iste amor tam improvisus ac tam repentinus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentit omnia repentina et nec opinata esse graviora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repentinus inopinatusque finis vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 87</bibl></cit> (shortly before, subita celerisque mors): <cit><quote lang="la">vis repentina et inexspectata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium (with temerarium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus (with tumultuarius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum (with praeceps),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus ac defectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio Gallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoti homines et repentini,</quote> <trans><tr>upstart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repentina atque ex virtute nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">De repentino, adverb.,</quote> <trans><tr>suddenly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 353</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 365, 14</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus quanto repentinior est, tanto vehementior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 61, 20</bibl></cit> (al. repentinus). — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (rare for repente): <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpen-tīnō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">suddenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reperco: <entryFree id="n41170" type="main" key="re^perco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕperco</orth>, v. reparco.</entryFree>
repercussibilis: <entryFree id="n41171" type="main" key="re^percussi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpercussĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>repercutio</etym>, <sense id="n41171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be struck back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can rebound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:6" default="NO">3, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
repercussio: <entryFree id="n41172" type="main" key="re^percussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpercussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rebounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repercussion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinorum siderum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reflection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repercussus: <entryFree id="n41173" type="main" key="re^percussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpercussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from repercutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41174" type="main" key="re^percussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpercussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>repercutio</etym>, <sense id="n41174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rebounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverberation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repercussion</hi>, of light, sound, wind, etc.; <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counter-pressure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3 al.</bibl></cit>: attolli colles occursantium inter se radicum repercussu, <hi rend="ital">by the meeting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowding together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, ex splendore galearum, et repercussu, quasi ardere caelum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 61</bibl></cit> (69), 4.</sense></entryFree>
repercutio: <entryFree id="n41175" type="main" key="re^percu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-percŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to rebound;</hi> <cb n="REPE" /> <hi rend="ital">to reflect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf.: repello, reflecto). </sense><sense id="n41175.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of light, sound, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae Clara repercusso reddebant lumina Phoebo,</quote> <trans><tr>reflected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes clipei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa repercussae imaginis umbra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:434" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 434</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis anfractu repercussae voces,</quote> <trans><tr>re-echoing</tr>, <tr>resounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41175.2" n="B" level="2"> Of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">(discus) repercussus,</quote> <trans><tr>rebounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 184</bibl></cit> Jahn <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigem cum e navi fluctus abjecisset, altero latere repercussum fluctus contrarius in navem retulit,</quote> <trans><tr>hurled back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita est aliquid quod hujus fontis excursum repercutiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41175.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena aut reprehendimus, aut refutamus, aut elevamus, aut repercutimus, aut eludimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repercutiendi multa sunt genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: orationes dicto, Plin. praef. § 31: fascinationes (despuendo), <hi rend="ital">to avert</hi> (syn. aversari), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:28:4:7:section=35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reperio: <entryFree id="n41176" type="main" key="re^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>repperi</itype> (less correctly reperi), rĕpertum, 4 (old <sense id="n41176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> reperibit, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperibitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> reperirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 480</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pario</etym> (orig., perh., <hi rend="ital">to procure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">find again;</hi> hence), in gen., <hi rend="ital">to find</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>, either by searching or by accident (cf.: invenio, offendo, nanciscor). </sense><sense id="n41176.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illam reperiam,</quote> <trans><tr>will find her again</tr>, <tr>will find her out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glycerium suos parentes repperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perscrutabor fanum, si inveniam uspiam Aurum: sed si repperero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid repperisti? Non quod pueri clamitant in fabā se repperisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile invenies pejorem ... meliorem neque tu reperies, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curculiones in tritico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 654</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui sunt reperti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum aut puellam sibi recens natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi quoque equi caput repertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum artium repertos antistites agriculturae neque discipulos neque praeceptores inventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiis incubare repertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 610</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41176.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41176.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to find</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern; to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter paupertatem nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:11:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 11, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis malam rem quaeris, illic reperias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 153</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaerimus, cur, etc. ... causas reperiemus verissimas duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem repperi omnem ex tuo magistro, ne nega,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verae amicitiae difficillime reperiuntur in iis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam difficilius quam reperire, quod sit omni ex parte in suo genere perfectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vos exitum reperitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauci lintribus inventis sibi salutem reppererunt,</quote> <trans><tr>found</tr>, <tr>obtained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristolochia nomen ex inventore reperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: sollicitudinis finem, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus praeclara apud Vergilium multa exempla reperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (armis) quemadmodum salutariter uterentur, non reperiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41176.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41176.5" n="1" level="3"> With a double predicate, <hi rend="ital">to find</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertain</hi> a thing to be in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">qui invident, omnes inimicos mihi istoc facto repperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si secus reperies, nullam causam dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam paucos reperias meretricibus Fideles evenire amatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">re ipsā repperi, Facilitate nihil esse homini melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum transgressos repperisset consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:50:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum de moribus Caesar cum quaereret, sic reperiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, quanta esset insulae magnitudo, reperire poterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 50: Caesar repperit ab Suevis auxilia missa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repperit esse vera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Tarentum venisse reperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.— So <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with a double subject (i.e. with a predicate <case>nom.</case>), <hi rend="ital">to be found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognized</hi> to be any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum censeas Esse amicos, reperiuntur falsi falsimoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="REPE" /> 6, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrato ingratus repertus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbissimus reperiebare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris rebus aut pares aut etiam inferiores reperiemur, religione multo superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 94</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam duplex natura duarum Dissimilis rerum longe constare reperta'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sybarim et Crotonem et in eas Italiae partes Pythagoras venisse reperitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulli periisse nisi in proelio reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41176.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hit upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi> (freq. after the Aug. period; cf. repertor; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas invenire is used in this signif. in all periods): reperi, comminiscere, cedo calidum consilium cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid calidi consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi aliquam astutiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repperisti tibi quod placeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihimet ineunda ratio et via reperiunda est, quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil novi reperiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc reperire difficilius, quam, cum inveneris, argumentis adjuvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperta verba (opp. nativa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina ex observatione salubrium reperta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:114" default="NO">9, 4, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludusque (scaenicus) repertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrae reperit usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 687</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repertā nuper conjuratione,</quote> <trans><tr>discovered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">posterius res inventa est aurumque repertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1240" default="NO" valid="yes">1240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quarum exercitationem reperta est (declamatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:21" default="NO">4, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:2" default="NO">4, 3, 2</bibl>; 8, 3, 72; 12, 10, 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl>.— With <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 19</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indi gemmas crystallum tingendo adulterare repererunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 20, § 79</bibl></cit> (where, however, Jahn reads invenerunt).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕperta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inventions</hi> (mostly in Lucr.): <cit><quote lang="la">exponunt praeclara reperta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 732</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:136" default="NO" valid="yes">136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2</bibl>; 13; 6, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">and (perh. in imitation),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reperticius: <entryFree id="n41177" type="main" key="re^perti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reperio</etym>, <sense id="n41177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accidentally met</hi> or <hi rend="ital">found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">random</hi>: quasi unus reliquus ex familiā Scipionis, ac non reperticius civis, Sal. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Decl. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repertio: <entryFree id="n41178" type="main" key="re^perti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n41178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">device</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoricae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor, 4, p. 360, 12</bibl></cit> Hild. (dub.; al. repertoribus).</sense></entryFree>
repertor: <entryFree id="n41179" type="main" key="re^pertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> II. B. 2</bibl>.</etym>, <sense id="n41179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a discoverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deviser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inventor): vitis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:762" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminis et medicae opis, Phoebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Æsculapius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum rerumque,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinarum atque leporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1049" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1049</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallae honestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinorum omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitii ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis rhetoricae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor 4, p. 360, 12</bibl></cit> codd. (v. repertio).</sense></entryFree>
repertorium: <entryFree id="n41180" type="main" key="re^perto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>reperio</etym>, <sense id="n41180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catalogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repertory</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repertrix: <entryFree id="n41181" type="hapax" key="re^pertrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repertor</etym>, <sense id="n41181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that finds out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inventress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium (Minerva),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 46, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium artium paupertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 285, 35</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecclesia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
repertus: <entryFree id="n41182" type="main" key="re^pertus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from reperio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41183" type="main" key="re^pertus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpertus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reperio</etym> (Appuleian). <sense id="n41183.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A finding again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41183.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A discovery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invention</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 262, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 341, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repetentia: <entryFree id="n41184" type="main" key="re^pe^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpĕtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>repeto</etym>, <sense id="n41184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">memory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remembrance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2</bibl>, pp. 61 and 62 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 851</bibl>, the correct read. is retinentia).</sense></entryFree>
repetitio: <entryFree id="n41185" type="main" key="re^pe^ti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpĕtītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n41185.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A demanding back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reclamation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, repetitionem habere, i.e. jus repetendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41185.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A repetition</hi>, in speaking or writing: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitio frequentior ejusdem nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">6: probationis ejusdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:22" default="NO">9, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1" default="NO">6, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugere repetitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: repetitio instauratioque ejusdem rei sub alio nomine, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25</bibl> (24), 9: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 19</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41185.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic. <pb n="1569" /> <cb n="REPE" /> rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a repetition of the same word at the beginning of several sentences</hi>: anaphora, <foreign lang="greek">a)nafora/,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 13, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 533</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
repetitor: <entryFree id="n41186" type="hapax" key="re^pe^ti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpĕtītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>repeto</etym>, <sense id="n41186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that demands back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reclaimer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptae ademptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
repetitus: <entryFree id="n41187" type="main" key="re^pe^ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpĕtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from repeto.</entryFree>
repeto: <entryFree id="n41188" type="main" key="re^pe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-pĕto</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n41188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attack again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike again</hi> (syn. repercutio). </sense><sense id="n41188.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (in gen. not till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">regem repetitum saepius cuspide ad terram affixit,</quote> <trans><tr>after he had repeatedly attacked him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulam calcibus et canem morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetita per ilia ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 733</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 562</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis cavere, bis repetere,</quote> <trans><tr>to attack twice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum erat omnium, Repete!</quote> <trans><tr>strike again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Nolam armis repetendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitus toxico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Claud. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Claud. 44</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41188.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n41188.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prosecute again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicione propositā, ut, si quem quis repetere vellet, par periculum poenae subiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:10" default="NO">48, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41188.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seek again; to go back to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revisit</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n41188.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratresque virumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nearchum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates, ab orā Hispanā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam, quā venisset,</quote> <trans><tr>to retrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25</bibl></cit>. 27: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro Apuliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 58</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus Bithyniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem atque ordinem senatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesepia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam (shortly before, redire in pugnam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41188.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerarias retro in Africam repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vada,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad prima vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 245</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41188.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim repetiimus (sc. patriam)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi repetunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl>; 14 al. — </sense><sense id="n41188.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n41188.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fetch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">take back</hi> (cf. revoco). </sense><sense id="n41188.10" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium istinc repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiatus repetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lysias est Atticus, quamquam Timaeus eum quasi Liciniā et Muciā lege repetit Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui maxime me repetistis atque revocastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigo in Ephesum, ut aurum repetam ab Theotimo domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec (impedimenta) repetenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thoracem Magni Alexandri e conditorio ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem reliquam copiarum continenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii (elephanti) deinde repetiti ac trajecti sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>others were then brought and passed over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alium repetat in eundem rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 61" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 61</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41188.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in partic. </sense><sense id="n41188.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take hold of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">undertake again; to enter upon again; to recommence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi> an action, a speech, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">renovo, restauro): praetermissa repetimus, incohata persequimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo intervallo haec studia repetentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio carens hac virtute (sc. ordine) necesse est multa repetat, multa transeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: ad verbum repetita reddantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 39</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem vetera consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc primus repetas opus, hoc postremus omittas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susurri Compositā repetantur horā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:20:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitum Mulciber aevum Poscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia de integro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit> acrius bellum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula ex antiquitate,</quote> <trans><tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genera ignominiarum ex antiquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mutatione litterarum nihil repetere hic necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetam necesse est, infinitas esse species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:46" default="NO">46</bibl>: ut repetam coeptum pertexere dictis, Lucr. <cb n="REPE" /> 1, 418; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commemorare res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:936" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 936</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕpĕtītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, as an <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetita suis percussit pectora palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 473</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 287</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora caedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:769" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera mollibat longo tractu,</quote> <trans><tr>by drawing out repeatedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec decies repetita placebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 365</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n41188.13" n="b" level="4"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derive from</hi> anywhere; <hi rend="ital">to go back to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin from</hi> anywhere (cf. deduco): <cit><quote lang="la">populum a stirpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetere populi originem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius juris ortum a fonte ... stirpem juris a naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque a Corace nescio quo et Tisiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ultimā antiquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis erit narratio, si non ab ultimo repetetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid a Platonis auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressio non ex oratoriis disputationibus ducta sed e mediā philosophiā repetita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res remotas ex litterarum monumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: initia amicitiae ex parentibus nostris, Bithyn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ex ultimis tenebris, ex vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:49" default="NO">11, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO">1, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte vero et, ut oportet, a capite repetis, quod quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam longa et tam alte repetita oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetam paulo altius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius omnem Expediam primā repetens ab origine famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 286</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:2" default="NO">6, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:62" default="NO">11, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transilire ante pedes posita et alia longe repetita sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 160</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:23" default="NO">5, 11, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitis atque enumeratis diebus,</quote> <trans><tr>reckoned backwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">repetitis diebus ex die vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:51:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 51, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitā die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 4, 9, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15:section=31" default="NO">39, 2, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:1:section=10" default="NO">43, 19, 1, § 10</bibl>; 22, 4, 3.—</sense><sense id="n41188.14" n="c" level="4"> Repetere aliquid memoriā, memoriam rei, or (rarely without memoriā) aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to call up again in the mind; to call to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">revoco, recordor): cogitanti mihi saepenumero et memoriā vetera repetenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repete memoriā tecum, quando, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev.
