Vit. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: memoriā repeto, diem esse hodiernum, quo, etc., Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repete temporis illius memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam ex annalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris cujusdam memoriae recordationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">memoriā</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reminisci quom ea, quae tenuit mens ac memoria, cogitando repetuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 44</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnium mearum praecepta litterarum repetes, intelleges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra repetere et paucis instituta majorum disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde tuos primum repetam, mea Cynthia, fastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum repeto noctem, quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te animo repetentem exempla tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 439</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repeto, me correptum ab eo, cur ambularem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ante repetito, concordem sibi conjugem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde usque repetens, hoc video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor mihi talia (namque Nunc repeto) Anchises fatorum arcana reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41188.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">take again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">back; to demand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim</hi> what is due (syn. reposco). </sense><sense id="n41188.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n41188.17" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis mutuom quid dederit, fit pro proprio perditum, quom repetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque repeto pro illā quidquam abs te pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te sestertium miliens ex lege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ereptas pecunias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae erepta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes bello superatas in antiquum jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerum Colophonii civem esse dicunt suum, Chii suum vindicant, Salaminii repetunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero Gallum a Verticone repetit, qui litteras ad Caesarem referat,</quote> <trans><tr>applied again for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte suas repetitum venerit plumas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec repetita sequi curet Proserpina matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Politorium rursus bello,</quote> <trans><tr>to retake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41188.18" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cb n="REPL" /> qui repetit eam, quam ego patri suo quondam spoponderim, dignitatem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 42, 106</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo (beneficio) gratiam repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentum poenas a consceleratissimis filiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab isto eas poenas vi repetisse, aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne mors quidem sit in repetendā libertate fugiendā,</quote> <trans><tr>in the effort to recover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem per occasionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies ille libertatis improspere repetitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores quasi debitos ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 85:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repete a me rempublicam,</quote> <trans><tr>take back from me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 78</bibl></cit>: repetitumque, duobus uti mandaretur consulum nomen imperiumque, <hi rend="ital">it was demanded again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33</bibl>: se repetere, <hi rend="ital">to recover one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n41188.19" n="2" level="3"> In partic., publicists' and jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n41188.20" n="a" level="4"> Of the fetiales: repetere res, <hi rend="ital">to demand back from the enemy things which they had taken as booty;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to demand satisfaction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fetiales) mittebantur antequam conciperetur (bellum), qui res repeterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 86</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6</bibl>; 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure gentium res repeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">amissa bello repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:6:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. clarigatio and clarigo. —</sense><sense id="n41188.21" n="b" level="4"> In jurid. lang.: res repetere, <hi rend="ital">to demand back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reclaim one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property</hi> before a court: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis rebus repetendis, quae mancipi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, transf., in gen., <hi rend="ital">to seek to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reclaim</hi>: non ex jure manum consertum, sed magi' ferro Rem repetunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 277 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n41188.22" n="c" level="4"> Pecuniae repetundae, or simply repetundae, <hi rend="ital">money</hi> or <hi rend="ital">other things extorted by a provincial governor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and that are to be restored</hi> (at a later period, referring to any bribed officer): <cit><quote lang="la">L. Piso legem de pecuniis repetundis primus tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum causā judicium de pecuniis repetundis est constitutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clames te lege pecuniarum repetundarum non teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniarum repetundarum reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatus in judicio pecuniarum repetundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā lege a senatore ratio repeti solet de pecuniis repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare de pecuniis repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 41, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de pecuniis repetundis nomen cujuspiam deferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pecuniis repetundis ad recuperatores itum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">pecuniis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum causae, crimen, lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:5" default="NO">5, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:15" default="NO">4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 22</bibl>; 13, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum argui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: Pilius de repetundis eum postulavit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl> (for which, § <cit><quote lang="la">3, de pecuniis repetundis): neque absolutus neque damnatus Servilius de repetundis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: damnatum repetundis consularem virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
